verses.text: though your servant has found grace before you, and you have magnified your mercy, which you have shown to me in saving my life, I cannot be saved on the mountain, lest perhaps some misfortune take hold of me and I die.

verses.name: Genesis 19:20
verses.text: There is a certain city nearby, to which I can flee; it is a little one, and I will be saved in it. Is it not a modest one, and will not my soul live?”

verses.name: Genesis 19:21
verses.text: And he said to him: “Behold, even now, I have heard your petitions about this, not to overturn the city on behalf of which you have spoken.

verses.name: Genesis 19:22
verses.text: Hurry and be saved there. For I cannot do anything until you enter there.” For this reason, the name of that city is called Zoar.

verses.name: Genesis 19:23
verses.text: The sun had risen over the land, and Lot had entered into Zoar.

verses.name: Genesis 19:24
verses.text: Therefore, the Lord rained upon Sodom and Gomorrah sulphur and fire, from the Lord, out of heaven.

verses.name: Genesis 19:25
verses.text: And he overturned these cities, and all the surrounding region: all the inhabitants of the cities, and everything that springs from the land.

verses.name: Genesis 19:26
verses.text: And his wife, looking behind herself, was turned into a statue of salt.

verses.name: Genesis 19:27
verses.text: Then Abraham, rising up in the morning, in the place where he had stood before with the Lord,

verses.name: Genesis 19:28
verses.text: looked out toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and the entire land of that region. And he saw embers rising up from the land like smoke from a furnace.

verses.name: Genesis 19:29
verses.text: For when God overthrew the cities of that region, remembering Abraham, he freed Lot from the overthrow of the cities, in which he had dwelt.

verses.name: Genesis 19:30
verses.text: And Lot ascended from Zoar, and he stayed on the mountain, and likewise his two daughters with him, (for he was afraid to stay in Zoar) and he dwelt in a cave, he and his two daughters with him.

verses.name: Genesis 19:31
verses.text: And the elder said to the younger: “Our father is old, and no man remains in the land who can enter to us according to the custom of the whole world.

verses.name: Genesis 19:32
verses.text: Come, let us inebriate him with wine, and let us sleep with him, so that we may be able to preserve offspring from our father.”

verses.name: Genesis 19:33
verses.text: And so they gave their father wine to drink that night. And the elder went in, and she slept with her father. But he did not perceive it, neither when his daughter lay down, nor when she rose up.

verses.name: Genesis 19:34
verses.text: Likewise, the next day, the elder said to the younger: “Behold, yesterday I slept with my father, let us give him wine to drink yet again this night, and you will sleep with him, so that we may save offspring from our father.”

verses.name: Genesis 19:35
verses.text: And then they gave their father wine to drink that night also, and the younger daughter went in, and slept with him. And not even then did he perceive when she lay down, or when she rose up.

verses.name: Genesis 19:36
verses.text: Therefore, the two daughters of Lot conceived by their father.

verses.name: Genesis 19:37
verses.text: And the elder gave birth to a son, and she called his name Moab. He is the father of the Moabites, even to the present day.

verses.name: Genesis 19:38
verses.text: Likewise, the younger gave birth to a son, and she called his name Ammon, that is, ‘the son of my people.’ He is the father of the Ammonites, even today.

verses.name: Genesis 20:1
verses.text: Abraham advanced from there into the southern land, and he lived between Kadesh and Shur. And he sojourned in Gerar.

verses.name: Genesis 20:2
verses.text: And he said about his wife Sarah: “She is my sister.” Therefore, Abimelech, the king of Gerar, sent for her and took her.

verses.name: Genesis 20:3
verses.text: Then God came to Abimelech through a dream in the night, and he said to him: “Lo, you shall die because of the woman that you have taken. For she has a husband.”

verses.name: Genesis 20:4
verses.text: In truth, Abimelech had not touched her, and so he said: “Lord, would you put to death a people, ignorant and just?

verses.name: Genesis 20:5
verses.text: Did he not say to me, ‘She is my sister,’ and did she not say, ‘He is my brother?’ In the sincerity of my heart and the purity of my hands, I have done this.”

verses.name: Genesis 20:6
verses.text: And God said to him: “And I know that you have acted with a sincere heart. And therefore I kept you from sinning against me, and I did not release you to touch her.

verses.name: Genesis 20:7
verses.text: Now therefore, return his wife to the man, for he is a prophet. And he will pray for you, and you will live. But if you are not willing to return her, know this: you shall die a death, you and all that is yours.”

verses.name: Genesis 20:8
verses.text: And immediately Abimelech, rising up in the night, called all his servants. And he spoke all these words in their hearing, and all the men were very afraid.

verses.name: Genesis 20:9
verses.text: Then Abimelech called also for Abraham, and he said to him: “What have you done to us? How have we sinned against you, so that you would bring so great a sin upon me and upon my kingdom? You have done to us what you ought not to have done.”

verses.name: Genesis 20:10
verses.text: And remonstrating him again, he said, “What did you see, so that you would do this?”

verses.name: Genesis 20:11
verses.text: Abraham responded: “I thought to myself, saying: Perhaps there is no fear of God in this place. And they will put me to death because of my wife.

verses.name: Genesis 20:12
verses.text: Yet, in another way, she is also truly my sister, the daughter of my father, and not the daughter of my mother, and I took her as a wife.

verses.name: Genesis 20:13
verses.text: Then, after God led me out of my father’s house, I said to her: ‘You will show this mercy to me. In every place, to which we will travel, you will say that I am your brother.’ ”

verses.name: Genesis 20:14
verses.text: Therefore, Abimelech took sheep and oxen, and men servants and women servants, and he gave them to Abraham. And he returned his wife Sarah to him.

verses.name: Genesis 20:15
verses.text: And he said, “The land is in your sight. Dwell wherever it will please you.”

verses.name: Genesis 20:16
verses.text: Then to Sarah he said: “Behold, I have given your brother one thousand silver coins. This will be for you as a veil for your eyes, to all who are with you and wherever you will travel. And so, remember that you were taken.”

verses.name: Genesis 20:17
verses.text: Then when Abraham prayed, God healed Abimelech and his wife, and his handmaids, and they gave birth.

verses.name: Genesis 20:18
verses.text: For the Lord had closed every womb of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah, the wife of Abraham.

verses.name: Genesis 21:1
verses.text: Then the Lord visited Sarah, just as he had promised; and he fulfilled what he had spoken.

verses.name: Genesis 21:2
verses.text: And she conceived and gave birth to a son in her old age, at the time that God had foretold to her.

verses.name: Genesis 21:3
verses.text: And Abraham called the name of his son, whom Sarah bore for him, Isaac.

verses.name: Genesis 21:4
verses.text: And he circumcised him on the eighth day, just as God had instructed him,

verses.name: Genesis 21:5
verses.text: when he was one hundred years old. Indeed, at this stage of his father’s life, Isaac was born.

verses.name: Genesis 21:6
verses.text: And Sarah said: “God has brought laughter to me. Whoever will hear of it will laugh with me.”

verses.name: Genesis 21:7
verses.text: And again, she said: “Hearing this, who would believe Abraham, that Sarah breast-fed a son, to whom she gave birth, despite being elderly?”

verses.name: Genesis 21:8
verses.text: And the boy grew and was weaned. And Abraham made a great feast on the day of his weaning.

verses.name: Genesis 21:9
verses.text: And when Sarah had seen the son of Hagar the Egyptian playing with her son Isaac, she said to Abraham:

verses.name: Genesis 21:10
verses.text: “Cast out this woman servant and her son. For the son of a woman servant will not be heir with my son Isaac.”

verses.name: Genesis 21:11
verses.text: Abraham took this grievously, for the sake of his son.

verses.name: Genesis 21:12
verses.text: And God said to him: “Let it not seem harsh to you concerning the boy and your woman servant. In all that Sarah has said to you, listen to her voice. For your offspring will be invoked in Isaac.

verses.name: Genesis 21:13
verses.text: Yet I will also make the son of the woman servant into a great nation, for he is your offspring.”

verses.name: Genesis 21:14
verses.text: And so Abraham arose in the morning, and taking bread and a skin of water, he placed it upon her shoulder, and he handed over the boy, and he released her. And when she had departed, she wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.

verses.name: Genesis 21:15
verses.text: And when the water in the skin had been consumed, she set aside the boy, under one of the trees that were there.

verses.name: Genesis 21:16
verses.text: And she moved away and sat in a distant area, as far as a bow can reach. For she said, “I shall not see the boy die.” And so, sitting opposite her, he lifted up his voice and wept.

verses.name: Genesis 21:17
verses.text: But God heard the voice of the boy. And an Angel of God called to Hagar from heaven, saying: “What are you doing, Hagar? Do not be afraid. For God has heeded the voice of the boy, from the place where he is.

verses.name: Genesis 21:18
verses.text: Rise up. Take the boy and hold him by the hand. For I will make of him a great nation.”

verses.name: Genesis 21:19
verses.text: And God opened her eyes. And seeing a well of water, she went and filled the skin, and she gave the boy to drink.

verses.name: Genesis 21:20
verses.text: And God was with him. And he grew, and he stayed in the wilderness, and he became a young man, an archer.

verses.name: Genesis 21:21
verses.text: And he lived in the desert of Paran, and his mother took a wife for him from the land of Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 21:22
verses.text: At the same time, Abimelech and Phicol, the leader of his army, said to Abraham: “God is with you in everything that you do.

verses.name: Genesis 21:23
verses.text: Therefore, swear by God that you will do no harm to me, and to my posterity, and to my stock. But according to the mercy that I have done to you, you will do to me and to the land, to which you have turned as a newcomer.”

verses.name: Genesis 21:24
verses.text: And Abraham said, “I will swear.”

verses.name: Genesis 21:25
verses.text: And he reproved Abimelech because of a well of water, which his servants had taken away by force.

verses.name: Genesis 21:26
verses.text: And Abimelech responded, “I do not know who did this thing, but you also did not reveal it to me, nor have I heard of it, before today.”

verses.name: Genesis 21:27
verses.text: And so Abraham took sheep and oxen, and he gave them to Abimelech. And both of them struck a pact.

verses.name: Genesis 21:28
verses.text: And Abraham set aside seven female lambs from the flock.

verses.name: Genesis 21:29
verses.text: Abimelech said to him, “What purpose have these seven female lambs, which you have caused to stand separately?”

verses.name: Genesis 21:30
verses.text: But he said, “You will receive seven female lambs from my hand, so that they may be a testimony for me, that I dug this well.”

verses.name: Genesis 21:31
verses.text: For this reason, that place was called Beersheba, because there both of them did swear.

verses.name: Genesis 21:32
verses.text: And they initiated a pact on behalf of the well of oath.

verses.name: Genesis 21:33
verses.text: Then Abimelech and Phicol, the leader of his army, rose up, and they returned to the land of the Palestinians. In truth, Abraham planted a grove in Beersheba, and there he called upon the name of the Lord God Eternal.

verses.name: Genesis 21:34
verses.text: And he was a settler in the land of the Palestinians for many days.

verses.name: Genesis 22:1
verses.text: After these things occurred, God tested Abraham, and he said to him, “Abraham, Abraham.” And he answered, “Here I am.”

verses.name: Genesis 22:2
verses.text: He said to him: “Take your only begotten son Isaac, whom you love, and go into the land of vision. And there you shall offer him as a holocaust upon one of the mountains, which I will show to you.”

verses.name: Genesis 22:3
verses.text: And so Abraham, getting up in the night, harnessed his donkey, taking with him two youths, and his son Isaac. And when he had cut wood for the holocaust, he traveled toward the place, as God had instructed him.

verses.name: Genesis 22:4
verses.text: Then, on the third day, lifting up his eyes, he saw the place at a distance.

verses.name: Genesis 22:5
verses.text: And he said to his servants: “Wait here with the donkey. I and the boy will hurry further ahead to that place. After we have worshipped, will return to you.”

verses.name: Genesis 22:6
verses.text: He also took the wood for the holocaust, and he imposed it upon his son Isaac. And he himself carried in his hands fire and a sword. And as the two continued on together,

verses.name: Genesis 22:7
verses.text: Isaac said to his father, “My father.” And he answered, “What do you want, son?” “Behold,” he said, “fire and wood. Where is the victim for the holocaust?”

verses.name: Genesis 22:8
verses.text: But Abraham said, “God himself will provide the victim for the holocaust, my son.” Thus they continued on together.

verses.name: Genesis 22:9
verses.text: And they came to the place that God had shown to him. There he built an altar, and he set the wood in order upon it. And when he had bound his son Isaac, he laid him on the altar upon the pile of wood.

verses.name: Genesis 22:10
verses.text: And he reached out his hand and took hold of the sword, in order to sacrifice his son.

verses.name: Genesis 22:11
verses.text: And behold, an Angel of the Lord called out from heaven, saying, “Abraham, Abraham.” And he answered, “Here I am.”

verses.name: Genesis 22:12
verses.text: And he said to him, “Do not extend your hand over the boy, and do not do anything to him. Now I know that you fear God, since you have not spared your only begotten son for my sake.”

verses.name: Genesis 22:13
verses.text: Abraham lifted up his eyes, and he saw behind his back a ram among the thorns, caught by the horns, which he took and offered as a holocaust, instead of his son.

verses.name: Genesis 22:14
verses.text: And he called the name of that place: ‘The Lord Sees.’ Thus, even to this day, it is said: ‘On the mountain, the Lord will see.’

verses.name: Genesis 22:15
verses.text: Then the Angel of the Lord called out to Abraham a second time from heaven, saying:

verses.name: Genesis 22:16
verses.text: “By my own self, I have sworn, says the Lord. Because you have done this thing, and have not spared your only begotten son for my sake,

verses.name: Genesis 22:17
verses.text: I will bless you, and I will multiply your offspring like the stars of heaven, and like the sand which is on the seashore. Your offspring will possess the gates of their enemies.

verses.name: Genesis 22:18
verses.text: And in your offspring, all the nations of the earth will be blessed, because you obeyed my voice.”

verses.name: Genesis 22:19
verses.text: Abraham returned to his servants, and they went to Beersheba together, and he lived there.

verses.name: Genesis 22:20
verses.text: After these things occurred, it was reported to Abraham that Milcah, likewise, had borne sons for his brother Nahor:

verses.name: Genesis 22:21
verses.text: Uz, the firstborn, and Buz, his brother, and Kemuel, the father of the Syrians,

verses.name: Genesis 22:22
verses.text: and Chesed, and Hazo, likewise Pildash, and Jidlaph,

verses.name: Genesis 22:23
verses.text: as well as Bethuel, of whom was born Rebekah. These eight Milcah bore for Nahor, the brother of Abraham.

verses.name: Genesis 22:24
verses.text: In truth, his concubine, named Reumah, bore Tebah, and Gaham, and Tahash, and Maacah.

verses.name: Genesis 23:1
verses.text: Now Sarah lived for one hundred and twenty-seven years.

verses.name: Genesis 23:2
verses.text: And she died in the city of Arba, which is Hebron, in the land of Canaan. And Abraham came to mourn and weep for her.

verses.name: Genesis 23:3
verses.text: And when he had risen up from the funeral duties, he spoke to the sons of Heth, saying:

verses.name: Genesis 23:4
verses.text: “I am a newcomer and a sojourner among you. Give me the right of a sepulcher among you, so that I may bury my dead.”

verses.name: Genesis 23:5
verses.text: The sons of Heth responded by saying:

verses.name: Genesis 23:6
verses.text: “Hear us, O lord, you are a leader of God among us. Bury your dead in our chosen sepulchers. And no man shall be able to prohibit you from burying your dead within his memorial.”

verses.name: Genesis 23:7
verses.text: Abraham arose, and he reverenced the people of the land, namely, the sons of Heth.

verses.name: Genesis 23:8
verses.text: And he said to them: “If it pleases your soul that I should bury my dead, hear me, and intercede on my behalf with Ephron, the son of Zohar,

verses.name: Genesis 23:9
verses.text: so that he may give me the double cave, which he has at the far end of his field. He may transfer it to me for as much money as it is worth in your sight, for the possession of a sepulcher.”

verses.name: Genesis 23:10
verses.text: Now Ephron dwelt in the midst of the sons of Heth. And Ephron responded to Abraham in the hearing of everyone who was entering at the gate of his city, saying:

verses.name: Genesis 23:11
verses.text: “Let it never be so, my lord, but you should pay greater heed to what I say. The field I will transfer to you, and the cave that is in it. In the presence of the sons of my people, bury your dead.”

verses.name: Genesis 23:12
verses.text: Abraham reverenced in the sight of the people of the land.

verses.name: Genesis 23:13
verses.text: And he spoke to Ephron, standing in the midst of the people: “I ask you to hear me. I will give you money for the field. Take it, and so I will bury my dead in it.”

verses.name: Genesis 23:14
verses.text: And Ephron responded: “My lord, hear me.

verses.name: Genesis 23:15
verses.text: The land that you request is worth four hundred shekels of silver. This is the price between me and you. But how much is this? Bury your dead.”

verses.name: Genesis 23:16
verses.text: And when Abraham had heard this, he weighed out the money that Ephron had requested, in the hearing of the sons of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, of the approved public currency.

verses.name: Genesis 23:17
verses.text: And having confirmed that the field, in which there was a double cave overlooking Mamre, formerly belonged to Ephron, both it and the sepulcher, and all its trees, with all its surrounding limits,

verses.name: Genesis 23:18
verses.text: Abraham took it as a possession, in the sight of the sons of Heth and of everyone who was entering at the gate of his city.

verses.name: Genesis 23:19
verses.text: So then, Abraham buried his wife Sarah in the double cave of the field that overlooked Mamre. This is Hebron in the land of Canaan.

verses.name: Genesis 23:20
verses.text: And the field was confirmed to Abraham, with the cave that was in it, as a memorial possession before the sons of Heth.

verses.name: Genesis 24:1
verses.text: Now Abraham was old and of many days. And the Lord had blessed him in all things.

verses.name: Genesis 24:2
verses.text: And he said to the elder servant of his house, who was in charge of all that he had: “Place your hand under my thigh,

verses.name: Genesis 24:3
verses.text: so that I may make you swear by the Lord, the God of heaven and earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I live.

verses.name: Genesis 24:4
verses.text: But that you will proceed to my land and kindred, and from there take a wife for my son Isaac.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:5
verses.text: The servant responded, “If the woman is not willing to come with me into this land, must I lead your son back to the place from which you departed?”

verses.name: Genesis 24:6
verses.text: And Abraham said: “Beware that you never lead my son back to that place.

verses.name: Genesis 24:7
verses.text: The Lord God of heaven, who took me from my father’s house, and from the land of my nativity, who spoke to me and swore to me, saying, ‘To your offspring I will give this land,’ himself will send his Angel before you, and you will take from there a wife for my son.

verses.name: Genesis 24:8
verses.text: But if the woman is not willing to follow you, you will not be held by the oath. Only do not lead my son back to that place.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:9
verses.text: Therefore, the servant placed his hand under the thigh of Abraham, his lord, and he swore to him on his word.

verses.name: Genesis 24:10
verses.text: And he took ten camels from his lord’s herd, and he went forth, carrying with him things from all of his goods. And he set out, and continued on, to the city of Nahor, in Mesopotamia.

verses.name: Genesis 24:11
verses.text: And when he had made the camels lie down outside of the town, near a well of water, in the evening, at the time when women are accustomed to go out to draw water, he said:

verses.name: Genesis 24:12
verses.text: “O Lord, the God of my lord Abraham, meet with me today, I beg you, and show mercy to my lord Abraham.

verses.name: Genesis 24:13
verses.text: Behold, I stand near the fountain of water, and the daughters of the inhabitants of this city will go forth to draw water.

verses.name: Genesis 24:14
verses.text: Therefore, the girl to whom I will say, ‘Tip your pitcher, so that I may drink,’ and she will respond, ‘Drink. In fact, I will give your camels a drink also,’ the same one is she whom you have prepared for your servant Isaac. And by this, I will understand that you have shown mercy to my lord.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:15
verses.text: But he had not yet completed these words within himself, when, behold, Rebekah went out, the daughter of Bethuel, son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, the brother of Abraham, having a pitcher on her shoulder.

verses.name: Genesis 24:16
verses.text: She was an exceedingly elegant girl, and a most beautiful virgin, and unknown by man. And she descended to the spring, and she filled her pitcher, and then was returning.

verses.name: Genesis 24:17
verses.text: And the servant ran to meet her, and he said, “Provide me with a little water to drink from your pitcher.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:18
verses.text: And she responded, “Drink, my lord.” And she quickly brought down the pitcher on her arm, and she gave him a drink.

verses.name: Genesis 24:19
verses.text: And after he drank, she added, “In fact, I will draw water for your camels also, until they all drink.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:20
verses.text: And pouring out the pitcher into the troughs, she ran back to the well to draw water; and having drawn, she gave it to all the camels.

verses.name: Genesis 24:21
verses.text: But he was contemplating her silently, wanting to know whether the Lord had caused his journey to prosper or not

verses.name: Genesis 24:22
verses.text: Then, after the camels drank, the man took out gold earrings, weighing two shekels, and the same number of bracelets, ten shekels in weight.

verses.name: Genesis 24:23
verses.text: And he said to her: “Whose daughter are you? Tell me, is there any place in your father’s house to lodge?”

verses.name: Genesis 24:24
verses.text: She responded, “I am the daughter of Bethuel, the son of Milcah, to whom she gave birth for Nahor.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:25
verses.text: And she continued, saying, “There is very much straw and hay with us, and a spacious place to stay.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:26
verses.text: The man bowed himself down, and he adored the Lord,

verses.name: Genesis 24:27
verses.text: saying, “Blessed be the Lord, the God of my lord Abraham, who has not taken away his mercy and truth from my lord, and who has led me on a direct journey to the house of the brother of my lord.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:28
verses.text: And so the girl ran, and she reported all that she had heard in the house of her mother.

verses.name: Genesis 24:29
verses.text: Now Rebekah had a brother, named Laban, who went out quickly to the man, where the spring was.

verses.name: Genesis 24:30
verses.text: And when he had seen the earrings and bracelets in his sister’s hands, and he had heard all the words being repeated, “This is what the man spoke to me,” he came to the man who stood by the camels and near the spring of water,

verses.name: Genesis 24:31
verses.text: and he said to him: “Enter, O blessed of the Lord. Why do you stand outside? I have prepared the house, and a place for the camels.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:32
verses.text: And he brought him into his guest quarters. And he unharnessed the camels, and he distributed straw and hay, and water to wash his feet and that of the men who arrived with him.

verses.name: Genesis 24:33
verses.text: And bread was set out in his sight. But he said, “I will not eat, until I have spoken my words.” He answered him, “Speak.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:34
verses.text: Then he said: “I am the servant of Abraham.

verses.name: Genesis 24:35
verses.text: And the Lord has blessed my lord greatly, and he has become great. And he has given him sheep and oxen, silver and gold, men servants and women servants, camels and donkeys.

verses.name: Genesis 24:36
verses.text: And Sarah, the wife of my lord, has given birth to a son for my lord in her old age, and he has given him all that he had.

verses.name: Genesis 24:37
verses.text: And my lord made me swear, saying: ‘You shall not take a wife for my son from the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell.

verses.name: Genesis 24:38
verses.text: But you shall travel to my father’s house, and you shall take a wife of my own kindred for my son.’

verses.name: Genesis 24:39
verses.text: But truly, I answered my lord, ‘What if the woman is not willing to come with me?’

verses.name: Genesis 24:40
verses.text: ‘The Lord,’ he said, ‘in whose sight I walk, will send his Angel with you, and he will direct your way. And you shall take a wife for my son from my own kindred and from my father’s house.

verses.name: Genesis 24:41
verses.text: But you will be innocent of my curse, if, when you will arrive at my close relatives, they will not grant this to you.’

verses.name: Genesis 24:42
verses.text: And so, today I arrived at the well of water, and I said: ‘O Lord, the God of my lord Abraham, if you have directed my way, in which I now walk,

verses.name: Genesis 24:43
verses.text: behold, I stand next to the well of water, and the virgin, who will go forth to draw water, will hear from me, “Give me a little water to drink from your pitcher.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:44
verses.text: And she will say to me, “You drink, and I will also draw for your camels.” Let the same be the woman, whom the Lord has prepared for the son of my lord.’

verses.name: Genesis 24:45
verses.text: And while I thought over these things silently within myself, Rebekah appeared, arriving with a pitcher, which she carried on her shoulder. And she descended to the spring and drew water. And I said to her, ‘Give me a little to drink.’

verses.name: Genesis 24:46
verses.text: And she quickly let down the pitcher from her arm, and said to me, ‘You drink, and to your camels I will also distribute drinking water.’ I drank, and she watered the camels.

verses.name: Genesis 24:47
verses.text: And I questioned her, saying, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ And she responded, ‘I am the daughter of Bethuel, the son of Nahor, whom Milcah bore to him.’ And so, I hung the earrings on her, to adorn her face, and I put the bracelets on her hands.

verses.name: Genesis 24:48
verses.text: And falling prostrate, I adored the Lord, blessing the Lord, the God of my lord Abraham, who has led me along the straight path so as to take the daughter of my lord’s brother to his son.

verses.name: Genesis 24:49
verses.text: For this reason, if you would act according to mercy and truth with my lord, tell me so. But if it pleases you otherwise, say that to me also, so that I may go either to the right, or to the left.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:50
verses.text: And Laban and Bethuel responded: “A word has proceeded from the Lord. We are not able to speak anything else to you, beyond what pleases him.

verses.name: Genesis 24:51
verses.text: Lo, Rebekah is in your sight. Take her and continue on, and let her be the wife of the son of your lord, just as the Lord has spoken.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:52
verses.text: When Abraham’s servant had heard this, falling down to the ground, he adored the Lord.

verses.name: Genesis 24:53
verses.text: And bringing forth vessels of silver and gold, as well as garments, he gave them to Rebekah as a tribute. Likewise, he offered gifts to her brothers and her mother.

verses.name: Genesis 24:54
verses.text: And a banquet began, and they feasted and drank together, and they lodged there. And rising up in the morning, the servant said, “Release me, so that I may go to my lord.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:55
verses.text: And her brothers and mother responded, “Let the girl remain for at least ten days with us, and after that, she will continue on.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:56
verses.text: “Do not be willing,” he said, “to delay me, for the Lord has directed my way. Release me, so that I may journey to my lord.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:57
verses.text: And they said, “Let us call the girl, and ask her will.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:58
verses.text: And when, having been called, she arrived, they wanted to know, “Will you go with this man?” And she said, “I will go.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:59
verses.text: Therefore, they released her and her nurse, and the servant of Abraham and his companions,

verses.name: Genesis 24:60
verses.text: wishing prosperity for their sister, by saying: “You are our sister. May you increase to thousands of thousands. And may your offspring possess the gates of their enemies.”

verses.name: Genesis 24:61
verses.text: And so, Rebekah and her maids, riding upon camels, followed the man, who quickly returned to his lord.

verses.name: Genesis 24:62
verses.text: Then, at the same time, Isaac was walking along the way that leads to the well, whose name is: ‘of the One who lives and who sees.’ For he dwelt in the southern land.

verses.name: Genesis 24:63
verses.text: And he had gone out to meditate in the field, as daylight was now declining. And when he had lifted up his eyes, he saw camels advancing from afar.

verses.name: Genesis 24:64
verses.text: Likewise, Rebekah, having seen Isaac, descended from the camel.

verses.name: Genesis 24:65
verses.text: And she said to the servant, “Who is that man who advances to meet us through the field?” And he said to her, “That is my lord.” And so, quickly taking up her cloak, she covered herself.

verses.name: Genesis 24:66
verses.text: Then the servant explained to Isaac all that he had done.

verses.name: Genesis 24:67
verses.text: And he led her into the tent of Sarah his mother, and he accepted her as wife. And he loved her so very much, that it tempered the sorrow which befell him at his mother’s death.

verses.name: Genesis 25:1
verses.text: In truth, Abraham took another wife, named Keturah.

verses.name: Genesis 25:2
verses.text: And she bore to him Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.

verses.name: Genesis 25:3
verses.text: Likewise, Jokshan conceived Sheba and Dedan. The sons of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.

verses.name: Genesis 25:4
verses.text: And truly, from Midian was born Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.

verses.name: Genesis 25:5
verses.text: And Abraham gave everything that he possessed to Isaac.

verses.name: Genesis 25:6
verses.text: But to the sons of the concubines he gave generous gifts, and he separated them from his son Isaac, while he still lived, toward the eastern region.

verses.name: Genesis 25:7
verses.text: Now the days of Abraham’s life were one hundred and seventy-five years.

verses.name: Genesis 25:8
verses.text: And declining, he died in a good old age, and at an advanced stage of life, and full of days. And he was gathered to his people.

verses.name: Genesis 25:9
verses.text: And his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the double cave, which was situated in the field of Ephron, of the son of Zohar the Hittite, across from the region of Mamre,

verses.name: Genesis 25:10
verses.text: which he had bought from the sons of Heth. There he was buried, with his wife Sarah.

verses.name: Genesis 25:11
verses.text: And after his passing, God blessed his son Isaac, who lived near the well named ‘of the One who lives and who sees.’

verses.name: Genesis 25:12
verses.text: These are the generations of Ishmael, the son of Abraham, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah’s servant, bore to him.

verses.name: Genesis 25:13
verses.text: And these are the names of his sons according to their language and generations. The firstborn of Ishmael was Nebaioth, then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,

verses.name: Genesis 25:14
verses.text: likewise Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa,

verses.name: Genesis 25:15
verses.text: Hadad, and Tema, and Jetur, and Naphish, and Kedemah.

verses.name: Genesis 25:16
verses.text: These are the sons of Ishmael. And these are their names throughout their fortresses and towns: the twelve princes of their tribes.

verses.name: Genesis 25:17
verses.text: And the years of the life of Ishmael that passed were one hundred and thirty-seven. And declining, he died and was placed with his people.

verses.name: Genesis 25:18
verses.text: Now he had lived from Havilah as far as Shur, which overlooks Egypt as it approaches the Assyrians. He passed away in the sight of all his brothers.

verses.name: Genesis 25:19
verses.text: Likewise, these are the generations of Isaac, the son of Abraham. Abraham conceived Isaac,

verses.name: Genesis 25:20
verses.text: who, when he was forty years old, took Rebekah, the sister of Laban, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian from Mesopotamia, as a wife.

verses.name: Genesis 25:21
verses.text: And Isaac beseeched the Lord on behalf of his wife, because she was barren. And he heard him, and he gave conception to Rebekah.

verses.name: Genesis 25:22
verses.text: But the little ones struggled in her womb. So she said, “If it was to be so with me, what need was there to conceive?” And she went to consult the Lord.

verses.name: Genesis 25:23
verses.text: And responding, he said, “Two nations are in your womb, and two peoples will be divided out of your womb, and one people will overcome the other people, and the elder will serve the younger.”

verses.name: Genesis 25:24
verses.text: Now the time had arrived to give birth, and behold, twins were discovered in her womb.

verses.name: Genesis 25:25
verses.text: He who departed first was red, and entirely hairy like a pelt; and his name was called Esau. At once the other departed and he held his brother’s foot in his hand; and because of this he was called Jacob.

verses.name: Genesis 25:26
verses.text: Isaac was sixty years old when the little ones were born to him.

verses.name: Genesis 25:27
verses.text: And as adults, Esau became a knowledgeable hunter and a man of agriculture, but Jacob, a simple man, dwelt in tents.

verses.name: Genesis 25:28
verses.text: Isaac was fond of Esau, because he was fed from his hunting; and Rebekah loved Jacob.

verses.name: Genesis 25:29
verses.text: Then Jacob boiled a small meal. Esau, when he had arrived weary from the field,

verses.name: Genesis 25:30
verses.text: said to him, “Give me this red stew, for I am very tired.” For this reason, his name was called Edom.

verses.name: Genesis 25:31
verses.text: Jacob said to him, “Sell me your right of the firstborn.”

verses.name: Genesis 25:32
verses.text: He answered, “Lo, I am dying, what will the right of the firstborn provide for me?”

verses.name: Genesis 25:33
verses.text: Jacob said, “So then, swear to me.” Esau swore to him, and he sold his right of the firstborn.

verses.name: Genesis 25:34
verses.text: And so, taking bread and the food of lentils, he ate, and he drank, and he went away, giving little weight to having sold the right of the firstborn.

verses.name: Genesis 26:1
verses.text: Then, when a famine arose over the land, after that barrenness which had happened in the days of Abraham, Isaac went to Abimelech, king of the Palestinians, in Gerar.

verses.name: Genesis 26:2
verses.text: And the Lord appeared to him, and he said: “Do not descend into Egypt, but rest in the land that I will tell you,

verses.name: Genesis 26:3
verses.text: and sojourn in it, and I will be with you, and I will bless you. For to you and to your offspring I will give all these regions, completing the oath that I promised to Abraham your father.

verses.name: Genesis 26:4
verses.text: And I will multiply your offspring like the stars of heaven. And I will give to your posterity all these regions. And in your offspring all the nations of the earth will be blessed,

verses.name: Genesis 26:5
verses.text: because Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my precepts and commandments, and observed the ceremonies and the laws.”

verses.name: Genesis 26:6
verses.text: And so Isaac remained in Gerar.

verses.name: Genesis 26:7
verses.text: And when he was questioned by the men of that place about his wife, he answered, “She is my sister.” For he was afraid to confess her to be his mate, thinking that perhaps they would put him to death because of her beauty.

verses.name: Genesis 26:8
verses.text: And when very many days had passed, and he had remained in the same place, Abimelech, king of the Palestinians, gazing through a window, saw him being playful with Rebekah, his wife.

verses.name: Genesis 26:9
verses.text: And summoning him, he said: “It is clear that she is your wife. Why did you falsely claim her to be your sister?” He answered, “I was afraid, lest I might die because of her.”

verses.name: Genesis 26:10
verses.text: And Abimelech said: “Why have you burdened us? Someone from the people could have lain with your wife, and you would have brought a great sin upon us.” And he instructed all the people, saying,

verses.name: Genesis 26:11
verses.text: “Whoever will touch the wife of this man will die a death.”

verses.name: Genesis 26:12
verses.text: Then Isaac sowed in that land, and he found, in that same year, one hundredfold. And the Lord blessed him.

verses.name: Genesis 26:13
verses.text: And the man was enriched, and he continued prospering as well as increasing, until he became very great.

verses.name: Genesis 26:14
verses.text: Likewise, he had possessions of sheep and of herds, and a very large family. Because of this, the Palestinians envied him,

verses.name: Genesis 26:15
verses.text: so, at that time, they obstructed all the wells that the servants of his father Abraham had dug, filling them with soil.

verses.name: Genesis 26:16
verses.text: It reached a point where Abimelech himself said to Isaac, “Move away from us, for you have become very much more powerful than we.”

verses.name: Genesis 26:17
verses.text: And departing, he then went toward the torrent of Gerar, and he dwelt there.

verses.name: Genesis 26:18
verses.text: Again, he dug up other wells, which the servants of his father Abraham had dug, and which, after his death, the Philistines had formerly obstructed. And he called them by the same names that his father had called them before.

verses.name: Genesis 26:19
verses.text: And they dug in the torrent, and they found living water.

verses.name: Genesis 26:20
verses.text: But in that place also the shepherds of Gerar argued against the shepherds of Isaac, by saying, “It is our water.” For this reason, he called the name of the well, because of what had happened, ‘Calumny.’

verses.name: Genesis 26:21
verses.text: Then they dug up yet another one. And over that one also they fought, and he called it, ‘Enmity.’

verses.name: Genesis 26:22
verses.text: Advancing from there, he dug another well, over which they did not contend. And so he called its name, ‘Latitude,’ saying, “Now the Lord has expanded us and caused us to increase across the land.”

verses.name: Genesis 26:23
verses.text: Then he ascended from that place into Beersheba,

verses.name: Genesis 26:24
verses.text: where the Lord appeared to him on the same night, saying: “I am the God of Abraham your father. Do not be afraid, for I am with you. I will bless you, and I will multiply your offspring because of my servant Abraham.”

verses.name: Genesis 26:25
verses.text: And so he built an altar there. And he invoked the name of the Lord, and he stretched out his tent. And he instructed his servants to dig a well.

verses.name: Genesis 26:26
verses.text: When Abimelech, and Ahuzzath, his friend, and Phicol, the leader of the military, had arrived from Gerar to that place,

verses.name: Genesis 26:27
verses.text: Isaac said to them, “Why have you come to me, a man whom you hate, and whom you have expelled from among you?”

verses.name: Genesis 26:28
verses.text: And they responded: “We saw that the Lord is with you, and therefore we said: Let there be an oath between us, and let us initiate a pact,

verses.name: Genesis 26:29
verses.text: so that you may not do us any kind of harm, just as we have touched nothing of yours, and have not caused any injury to you, but with peace we released you, augmented by the blessing of the Lord.”

verses.name: Genesis 26:30
verses.text: Therefore, he made them a feast, and after the food and drink,

verses.name: Genesis 26:31
verses.text: arising in the morning, they swore to one another. And Isaac sent them away peacefully to their own place.

verses.name: Genesis 26:32
verses.text: Then, behold, on the same day the servants of Isaac came, reporting to him about a well which they had dug, and saying: “We have found water.”

verses.name: Genesis 26:33
verses.text: Therefore, he called it, ‘Abundance.’ And the name of the city was established as ‘Beersheba,’ even to the present day.

verses.name: Genesis 26:34
verses.text: In truth, at forty years of age, Esau took wives: Judith, the daughter of Beeri, the Hittite, and Basemath, the daughter of Elon, of the same place.

verses.name: Genesis 26:35
verses.text: And they both offended the mind of Isaac and Rebekah.

verses.name: Genesis 27:1
verses.text: Now Isaac was old, and his eyes were cloudy, and so he was not able to see. And he called his elder son Esau, and he said to him, “My son?” And he responded, “Here I am.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:2
verses.text: His father said to him: “You see that I am old, and I do not know the day of my death.

verses.name: Genesis 27:3
verses.text: Take your weapons, the quiver and the bow, and go out. And when you have taken something by hunting,

verses.name: Genesis 27:4
verses.text: make from it a small meal for me, just as you know I like, and bring it, so that I may eat and my soul may bless you before I die.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:5
verses.text: And when Rebekah had heard this, and he had gone out into the field to fulfill his father’s order,

verses.name: Genesis 27:6
verses.text: she said to her son Jacob: “I heard your father speaking with your brother Esau, and saying to him,

verses.name: Genesis 27:7
verses.text: ‘Bring to me from your hunting, and make me foods, so that I may eat and bless you in the sight of the Lord before I die.’

verses.name: Genesis 27:8
verses.text: Therefore, now my son, agree to my counsel,

verses.name: Genesis 27:9
verses.text: and go straight to the flock, and bring me two of the best young goats, so that from them I may make meat for your father, such as he willingly eats.

verses.name: Genesis 27:10
verses.text: Then, when you have brought these in and he has eaten, he may bless you before he dies.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:11
verses.text: He answered her: “You know that my brother Esau is a hairy man, and I am smooth.

verses.name: Genesis 27:12
verses.text: If my father should lay hands on me and perceive it, I am afraid lest he think me willing to mock him, and I will bring a curse upon myself, instead of a blessing.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:13
verses.text: And his mother said to him: “Let this curse be upon me, my son. Yet listen to my voice, and go directly to bring what I said.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:14
verses.text: He went out, and he brought, and he gave to his mother. She prepared the meats, just as she knew his father liked.

verses.name: Genesis 27:15
verses.text: And she clothed him with the very fine garments of Esau, which she had at home with her.

verses.name: Genesis 27:16
verses.text: And she encircled his hands with little pelts from the young goats, and she covered his bare neck.

verses.name: Genesis 27:17
verses.text: And she gave him the small meal, and she handed him the bread that she had baked.

verses.name: Genesis 27:18
verses.text: When he had carried these in, he said, “My father?” And he answered, “I’m listening. Who are you, my son?”

verses.name: Genesis 27:19
verses.text: And Jacob said: “I am Esau, your firstborn. I have done as you instructed me. Arise; sit and eat from my hunting, so that your soul may bless me.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:20
verses.text: And again Isaac said to his son, “How were you able to find it so quickly, my son?” He answered, “It was the will of God, so that what I sought met with me quickly.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:21
verses.text: And Isaac said, “Come here, so that I may touch you, my son, and may prove whether you are my son Esau, or not.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:22
verses.text: He approached his father, and when he had felt him, Isaac said: “The voice indeed is the voice of Jacob. But the hands are the hands of Esau.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:23
verses.text: And he did not recognize him, because his hairy hands made him seem similar to the elder one. Therefore, blessing him,

verses.name: Genesis 27:24
verses.text: he said, “Are you my son Esau?” He answered, “I am.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:25
verses.text: Then he said, “Bring me the foods from your hunting, my son, so that my soul may bless you.” And when he had eaten what was offered, he also brought forth wine for him. And after he finished it,

verses.name: Genesis 27:26
verses.text: he said to him, “Come to me and give me a kiss, my son.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:27
verses.text: He approached and kissed him. And immediately he perceived the fragrance of his garments. And so, blessing him, he said: “Behold, the smell of my son is like the smell of a plentiful field, which the Lord has blessed.

verses.name: Genesis 27:28
verses.text: May God give to you, from the dew of heaven and from the fatness of the earth, an abundance of grain and wine.

verses.name: Genesis 27:29
verses.text: And may the peoples serve you, and may the tribes reverence you. May you be the lord of your brothers, and may your mother’s sons bow down before you. Whoever curses you, may he be cursed, and whoever blesses you, may he be filled with blessings.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:30
verses.text: Scarcely had Isaac completed his words, and Jacob departed, when Esau arrived.

verses.name: Genesis 27:31
verses.text: And he brought his father foods cooked from his hunting, saying, “Arise, my father, and eat from your son’s hunting, so that your soul may bless me.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:32
verses.text: And Isaac said to him, “But who are you?” And he answered, “I am your firstborn son, Esau.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:33
verses.text: Isaac became frightened and very astonished. And wondering beyond what can be believed, he said: “Then who is he that a while ago brought me the prey from his hunting, from which I ate, before you arrived? And I blessed him, and he will be blessed.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:34
verses.text: Esau, having heard his father’s words, roared out with a great outcry. And, being confounded, he said, “But bless me also, my father.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:35
verses.text: And he said, “Your twin came deceitfully, and he received your blessing.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:36
verses.text: But he responded: “Justly is his name called Jacob. For he has supplanted me yet another time. My birthright he took away before, and now, this second time, he has stolen my blessing.” And again, he said to his father, “Have you not reserved a blessing for me also?”

verses.name: Genesis 27:37
verses.text: Isaac answered: “I have appointed him as your lord, and I have subjugated all his brothers as his servants. I have reinforced him with grain and wine, and after this, my son, what more shall I do for you?”

verses.name: Genesis 27:38
verses.text: And Esau said to him: “Have you only one blessing, father? I beg you, bless me also.” And when he wept with a loud wail,

verses.name: Genesis 27:39
verses.text: Isaac was moved, and he said to him: “In the fatness of the earth, and in the dew of heaven from above,

verses.name: Genesis 27:40
verses.text: will your blessing be. You will live by the sword, and you will serve your brother. But the time will arrive when you will shake off and release his yoke from your neck.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:41
verses.text: Therefore, Esau always hated Jacob, for the blessing with which his father had blessed him. And he said in his heart, “The days will arrive for the mourning of my father, and I will kill my brother Jacob.”

verses.name: Genesis 27:42
verses.text: These things were reported to Rebekah. And sending and calling for her son Jacob, she said to him, “Behold, your brother Esau is threatening to kill you.

verses.name: Genesis 27:43
verses.text: Therefore, now my son, listen to my voice. Rise up and flee to my brother Laban, in Haran.

verses.name: Genesis 27:44
verses.text: And you will dwell with him for a few days, until the fury of your brother subsides,

verses.name: Genesis 27:45
verses.text: and his indignation ceases, and he forgets the things that you have done to him. After this, I will send for you and bring you from there to here. Why should I be bereaved of both my sons in one day?”

verses.name: Genesis 27:46
verses.text: And Rebekah said to Isaac, “I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth. If Jacob accepts a wife from the stock of this land, I would not be willing to live.”

verses.name: Genesis 28:1
verses.text: And so Isaac called for Jacob, and he blessed him, and he instructed him, saying: “Do not be willing to accept a mate from the family of Canaan.

verses.name: Genesis 28:2
verses.text: But go, and journey to Mesopotamia of Syria, to the house of Bethuel, your mother’s father, and there accept for yourself a wife from the daughters of Laban, your maternal uncle.

verses.name: Genesis 28:3
verses.text: And may God almighty bless you, and may he cause you to increase and also to multiply, so that you may be influential among the people.

verses.name: Genesis 28:4
verses.text: And may he give the blessings of Abraham to you, and to your offspring after you, so that you may possess the land of your sojourning, which he promised to your grandfather.”

verses.name: Genesis 28:5
verses.text: And when Isaac had dismissed him, setting out, he went to Mesopotamia of Syria, to Laban, the son of Bethuel, the Syrian, the brother to Rebekah, his mother.

verses.name: Genesis 28:6
verses.text: But Esau, seeing that his father had blessed Jacob and had sent him into Mesopotamia of Syria, to take a wife from there, and that, after the blessing, he had instructed him, saying: ‘You shall not accept a wife from the daughters of Canaan,’

verses.name: Genesis 28:7
verses.text: and that Jacob, obeying his parents, had gone into Syria,

verses.name: Genesis 28:8
verses.text: having evidence also that his father did not look with favor upon the daughters of Canaan,

verses.name: Genesis 28:9
verses.text: he went to Ishmael, and he took as a wife, beside those he had before, Mahalath, the daughter of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, the sister of Nebaioth.

verses.name: Genesis 28:10
verses.text: Meanwhile Jacob, having departed from Beersheba, continued on to Haran.

verses.name: Genesis 28:11
verses.text: And when he had arrived at a certain place, where he would rest after the setting of the sun, he took some of the stones that lay there, and placing them under his head, he slept in the same place.

verses.name: Genesis 28:12
verses.text: And he saw in his sleep: a ladder standing upon the earth, with its top touching heaven, also, the Angels of God ascending and descending by it,

verses.name: Genesis 28:13
verses.text: and the Lord, leaning upon the ladder, saying to him: “I am the Lord, the God of Abraham your father, and the God of Isaac. The land, in which you sleep, I will give to you and to your offspring.

verses.name: Genesis 28:14
verses.text: And your offspring will be like the dust of the earth. You will spread abroad to the West, and to the East, and to the North, and to the Meridian. And in you and in your offspring, all the tribes of the earth shall be blessed.

verses.name: Genesis 28:15
verses.text: And I will be your guardian wherever you will journey, and I will bring you back into this land. Neither will I dismiss you, until I have accomplished all that I have said.”

verses.name: Genesis 28:16
verses.text: And when Jacob had awakened from sleep, he said, “Truly, the Lord is in this place, and I did not know it.”

verses.name: Genesis 28:17
verses.text: And being terrified, he said: “How terrible this place is! This is nothing other than the house of God and the gateway of heaven.”

verses.name: Genesis 28:18
verses.text: Therefore, Jacob, arising in the morning, took the stone which he had placed under his head, and he set it up as monument, pouring oil over it.

verses.name: Genesis 28:19
verses.text: And he called the name of the city, ‘Bethel,’ which before was called Luz.

verses.name: Genesis 28:20
verses.text: And then he made a vow, saying: “If God will be with me, and will guard me along the way by which I walk, and will give me bread to eat and clothing to wear,

verses.name: Genesis 28:21
verses.text: and if I will return prosperously to my father’s house, then the Lord will be my God,

verses.name: Genesis 28:22
verses.text: and this stone, which I have set up as a monument, will be called ‘the House of God.’ And from all the things that you will give to me, I will offer tithes to you.”

verses.name: Genesis 29:1
verses.text: And so Jacob, setting out, arrived in the eastern land.

verses.name: Genesis 29:2
verses.text: And he saw a well in a field, and also three flocks of sheep reclining near it. For the animals were watered from it, and its mouth was closed with a great stone.

verses.name: Genesis 29:3
verses.text: And the custom was, when all the sheep were gathered together, to roll away the stone. And when the flocks had been refreshed, they placed it over the mouth of the well again.

verses.name: Genesis 29:4
verses.text: And he said to the shepherds, “Brothers, where are you from?” And they answered. “From Haran.”

verses.name: Genesis 29:5
verses.text: And questioning them, he said, “Do you know Laban, the son of Nahor?” They said, “We know him.”

verses.name: Genesis 29:6
verses.text: He said, “Is he well?” “He is very well,” they said. “And behold, his daughter Rachel approaches with his flock.”

verses.name: Genesis 29:7
verses.text: And Jacob said, “There is still much daylight remaining, and it is not time to return the flocks to the sheepfold. Give the sheep to drink first, and then lead them back to pasture.”

verses.name: Genesis 29:8
verses.text: They responded, “We cannot, until all the animals are gathered together and we remove the stone from the mouth of the well, so that we may water the flocks.”

verses.name: Genesis 29:9
verses.text: They were still speaking, and behold, Rachel arrived with her father’s sheep; for she pastured the flock.

verses.name: Genesis 29:10
verses.text: When Jacob had seen her, and he realized that she was his maternal first cousin, and that these were the sheep of his uncle Laban, he removed the stone which closed the well.

verses.name: Genesis 29:11
verses.text: And having watered the flock, he kissed her. And lifting up his voice, he wept.

verses.name: Genesis 29:12
verses.text: And he revealed to her that he was a brother of her father, and the son of Rebekah. And so, hurrying, she announced it to her father.

verses.name: Genesis 29:13
verses.text: And when he had heard that Jacob, his sister’s son, had arrived, he ran to meet him. And embracing him, and kissing him heartily, he brought him into his house. But when he had heard the reasons for his journey,

verses.name: Genesis 29:14
verses.text: he responded, “You are my bone and my flesh.” And after the days of one month were completed,

verses.name: Genesis 29:15
verses.text: he said to him: “Though you are my brother, will you serve me for nothing? Tell me what wages you would accept.”

verses.name: Genesis 29:16
verses.text: In truth, he had two daughters: the name of the elder was Leah; and truly the younger was called Rachel.

verses.name: Genesis 29:17
verses.text: But while Leah was bleary-eyed, Rachel had an elegant appearance and was attractive to behold.

verses.name: Genesis 29:18
verses.text: And Jacob, loving her, said, “I will serve you for seven years, for your younger daughter Rachel.”

verses.name: Genesis 29:19
verses.text: Laban responded, “It is better that I give her to you than to another man; remain with me.”

verses.name: Genesis 29:20
verses.text: Therefore, Jacob served for seven years for Rachel. And these seemed like only a few days, because of the greatness of love.

verses.name: Genesis 29:21
verses.text: And he said to Laban, “Give my wife to me. For now the time has been fulfilled, so that I may go in to her.”

verses.name: Genesis 29:22
verses.text: And he, having called a great crowd of his friends to the feast, agreed to the marriage.

verses.name: Genesis 29:23
verses.text: And at night, he brought in his daughter Leah to him,

verses.name: Genesis 29:24
verses.text: giving his daughter a handmaid named Zilpah. After Jacob had gone in to her, according to custom, when morning had arrived, he saw Leah.

verses.name: Genesis 29:25
verses.text: And he said to his father-in-law, “What is it that you intended to do? Did I not serve you for Rachel? Why have you deceived me?”

verses.name: Genesis 29:26
verses.text: Laban responded, “It is not the practice in this place to give the younger in marriage first.

verses.name: Genesis 29:27
verses.text: Complete a week of days with this mating. And then I will give this one to you also, for the service that you will provide to me for another seven years.”

verses.name: Genesis 29:28
verses.text: He agreed to his pleading. And after the week had passed, he took Rachel as a wife.

verses.name: Genesis 29:29
verses.text: To her, the father had given Bilhah as her servant.

verses.name: Genesis 29:30
verses.text: And, having at last obtained the marriage he desired, he preferred the love of the latter before the former, and he served with him another seven years.

verses.name: Genesis 29:31
verses.text: But the Lord, seeing that he despised Leah, opened her womb, but her sister remained barren.

verses.name: Genesis 29:32
verses.text: Having conceived, she gave birth to a son, and she called his name Reuben, saying: “The Lord saw my humiliation; now my husband will love me.”

verses.name: Genesis 29:33
verses.text: And again she conceived and bore a son, and she said, “Because the Lord heard that I was treated with contempt, he has also given this one to me.” And she called his name Simeon.

verses.name: Genesis 29:34
verses.text: And she conceived a third time, and she gave birth to another son, and she said: “Now likewise my husband will unite with me, because I have borne him three sons.” And because of this, she called his name Levi.

verses.name: Genesis 29:35
verses.text: A fourth time she conceived and bore a son, and she said, “Only now will I confess to the Lord.” And for this reason, she called him Judah. And she ceased from child-bearing.

verses.name: Genesis 30:1
verses.text: Then Rachel, discerning that she was infertile, envied her sister, and so she said to her husband, “Give me children, otherwise I will die.”

verses.name: Genesis 30:2
verses.text: Jacob, being angry, responded to her, “Am I in the place of God, who has deprived you of the fruit of your womb?”

verses.name: Genesis 30:3
verses.text: But she said: “I have a handmaid Bilhah. Go in to her, so that she may give birth upon my knees, and I may have sons by her.”

verses.name: Genesis 30:4
verses.text: And she gave him Bilhah in marriage.

verses.name: Genesis 30:5
verses.text: And when her husband had gone in to her, she conceived and bore a son.

verses.name: Genesis 30:6
verses.text: And Rachel said, “The Lord has judged for me, and he has heeded my voice, giving me a son.” And because of this, she called his name Dan.

verses.name: Genesis 30:7
verses.text: And conceiving again, Bilhah bore another,

verses.name: Genesis 30:8
verses.text: about whom Rachel said, “God has compared me with my sister, and I have prevailed.” And she called him Naphtali.

verses.name: Genesis 30:9
verses.text: Leah, perceiving that she had desisted from child-bearing, delivered Zilpah, her handmaid, to her husband.

verses.name: Genesis 30:10
verses.text: And she, after having borne a son with difficulty,

verses.name: Genesis 30:11
verses.text: said: “Happiness!” And for this reason, she called his name Gad.

verses.name: Genesis 30:12
verses.text: Likewise, Zilpah bore another.

verses.name: Genesis 30:13
verses.text: And Leah said, “This one is for my happiness. Indeed, women will call me blessed.” Because of this, she called him Asher.

verses.name: Genesis 30:14
verses.text: Then Reuben, going out into the field at the time of the wheat harvest, found mandrakes. These he brought to his mother Leah. And Rachel said, “Give me a portion of your son’s mandrakes.”

verses.name: Genesis 30:15
verses.text: She responded, “Does it seem like such a small matter to you, that you have usurped from me my husband, unless you will also take my son’s mandrakes?” Rachel said, “He will sleep with you this night because of your son’s mandrakes.”

verses.name: Genesis 30:16
verses.text: And when Jacob returned from the field in the evening, Leah went out to meet him, and she said, “You will enter to me, because I have hired you for the reward of my son’s mandrakes.” And he slept with her that night.

verses.name: Genesis 30:17
verses.text: And God heard her prayers. And she conceived and bore a fifth son.

verses.name: Genesis 30:18
verses.text: And she said, “God has given a reward to me, because I gave my handmaid to my husband.” And she called his name Issachar.

verses.name: Genesis 30:19
verses.text: Conceiving again, Leah bore a sixth son.

verses.name: Genesis 30:20
verses.text: And she said: “God has endowed me with a good dowry. And now, at this turn, my husband will be with me, because I have conceived six sons for him.” And therefore she called his name Zebulun.

verses.name: Genesis 30:21
verses.text: After him, she bore a daughter, named Dinah.

verses.name: Genesis 30:22
verses.text: The Lord, likewise remembering Rachel, heeded her and opened her womb.

verses.name: Genesis 30:23
verses.text: And she conceived and bore a son, saying, “God has taken away my reproach.”

verses.name: Genesis 30:24
verses.text: And she called his name Joseph, saying, “The Lord has added to me another son.”

verses.name: Genesis 30:25
verses.text: But when Joseph was born, Jacob said to his father-in-law: “Release me, so that I may return to my native country and to my land.

verses.name: Genesis 30:26
verses.text: Give me my wives, and my children, for whom I have served you, so that I may depart. You know the servitude with which I have served you.”

verses.name: Genesis 30:27
verses.text: Laban said to him: “May I find grace in your sight. I have learned by experience that God has blessed me because of you.

verses.name: Genesis 30:28
verses.text: Choose your wages, which I will give you.”

verses.name: Genesis 30:29
verses.text: But he responded: “You know how I have served you, and how great your possession became in my hands.

verses.name: Genesis 30:30
verses.text: You had little before I came to you, and now you have achieved riches. And the Lord has blessed you since my arrival. It is just, therefore, that at some time I also should provide for my own house.”

verses.name: Genesis 30:31
verses.text: And Laban said, “What shall I give to you?” But he said, “I want nothing. But if you will do what I ask, I will feed and guard your sheep again.

verses.name: Genesis 30:32
verses.text: Go around through all your flocks and separate all the sheep of variegated or spotted fleece; and whatever will be darkened or blemished or variegated, as much among the sheep as among the goats, will be my wages.

verses.name: Genesis 30:33
verses.text: And my justice will answer on my behalf tomorrow, when the time of settlement arrives before you. And all that is not variegated or blemished or darkened, as much among the sheep as among the goats, these will prove me to be a thief.”

verses.name: Genesis 30:34
verses.text: And Laban said, “I hold favor for this request.”

verses.name: Genesis 30:35
verses.text: And on that day he separated the she-goats, and the sheep, and the he-goats, and the rams with variegations or with blemishes. But every one of the flock which was of one color, that is, of white or of black fleece, he delivered into the hands of his sons.

verses.name: Genesis 30:36
verses.text: And he established a distance of three days journey between himself and his son-in-law, who pastured the remainder of his flock.

verses.name: Genesis 30:37
verses.text: Then Jacob, taking green branches of poplar, and almond, and sycamore trees, debarked them in part. And when the bark was pulled off, in the parts that were stripped, there appeared whiteness, yet the parts that were left whole, remained green. And so, in this way the color was made variegated.

verses.name: Genesis 30:38
verses.text: And he placed them in the troughs, where the water was poured out, so that when the flocks had arrived to drink, they would have the branches before their eyes, and in their sight they might conceive.

verses.name: Genesis 30:39
verses.text: And it happened that, in the very heat of joining together, the sheep looked upon the branches, and they bore the blemished and the variegated, those speckled with diverse color.

verses.name: Genesis 30:40
verses.text: And Jacob divided the flock, and he set the branches in the troughs before the eyes of the rams. Now whatever was white or black belonged to Laban, but, in truth, the others belonged to Jacob, for the flocks were dispersed among one another.

verses.name: Genesis 30:41
verses.text: Therefore, when the first to arrive were climbing on the ewes, Jacob placed the branches in the troughs of water before the eyes of the rams and the sheep, so that they might conceive while they were gazing upon them.

verses.name: Genesis 30:42
verses.text: Yet when the late arrivals and the last to conceive were let in, he did not place these. And so those that arrived late became Laban’s, and those that arrived first became Jacob’s.

verses.name: Genesis 30:43
verses.text: And the man was enriched beyond limit, and he had many flocks, women servants and men servants, camels and donkeys.

verses.name: Genesis 31:1
verses.text: But afterwards, he heard the words of the sons of Laban, saying, “Jacob has taken all that was our father’s, and being enlarged by his ability, he has become famous.”

verses.name: Genesis 31:2
verses.text: Likewise, he observed that Laban’s face was not the same toward him as it was yesterday and the day before.

verses.name: Genesis 31:3
verses.text: Most importantly, the Lord was saying to him, “Return to the land of your fathers and to your generation, and I will be with you.”

verses.name: Genesis 31:4
verses.text: He sent and called for Rachel and Leah, in the field where he pastured the flocks,

verses.name: Genesis 31:5
verses.text: and he said to them: “I see that your father’s face is not the same toward me as it was yesterday and the day before. But the God of my father has been with me.

verses.name: Genesis 31:6
verses.text: And you know that I have served your father with all my strength.

verses.name: Genesis 31:7
verses.text: Even so, your father has circumvented me, and he has changed my wages ten times. And yet God has not permitted him to harm me.

verses.name: Genesis 31:8
verses.text: Whenever he said, ‘The speckled will be your wages,’ all the sheep gave birth to speckled newborns. Yet truly, when he said the contrary, ‘You will take whatever is white for your wages,’ all the flocks gave birth to white ones.

verses.name: Genesis 31:9
verses.text: And it is God who has taken your father’s substance and given it to me.

verses.name: Genesis 31:10
verses.text: For after the time had arrived for the ewes to conceive, I lifted up my eyes, and I saw in my sleep that the males climbing on the females were of variegated, and spotted, and diverse colors.

verses.name: Genesis 31:11
verses.text: And the Angel of God said to me in my sleep, ‘Jacob.’ And I responded, ‘Here I am.’

verses.name: Genesis 31:12
verses.text: And he said: ‘Lift up your eyes, and see that all the males climbing on the females are variegated, spotted, and also speckled. For I have seen all that Laban has done to you.

verses.name: Genesis 31:13
verses.text: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed the stone and made a vow to me. Now therefore arise, and depart from this land, returning to the land of your nativity.’ ”

verses.name: Genesis 31:14
verses.text: And Rachel and Leah responded: “Have we anything left behind among the resources and inheritance of our father’s house?

verses.name: Genesis 31:15
verses.text: Has he not considered us as foreigners, and sold us, and consumed our price?

verses.name: Genesis 31:16
verses.text: But God has taken our father’s riches and handed these to us and to our sons. Therefore, do all that God has instructed you.”

verses.name: Genesis 31:17
verses.text: And so Jacob rose up, and having placed the children and his wives upon camels, he went forth.

verses.name: Genesis 31:18
verses.text: And he took all his substance and flocks, and whatever he had acquired in Mesopotamia, and he journeyed to his father Isaac, in the land of Canaan.

verses.name: Genesis 31:19
verses.text: At that time, Laban had gone to shear the sheep, and so Rachel stole her father’s idols.

verses.name: Genesis 31:20
verses.text: And Jacob was not willing to confess to his father-in-law that he was fleeing.

verses.name: Genesis 31:21
verses.text: And when he had gone away with all such things that were justly his, and, having crossed the river, was continuing on toward Mount Gilead,

verses.name: Genesis 31:22
verses.text: it was reported to Laban on the third day that Jacob had fled.

verses.name: Genesis 31:23
verses.text: And taking his brothers with him, he pursued him for seven days. And he overtook him at Mount Gilead.

verses.name: Genesis 31:24
verses.text: And he saw in a dream, God saying to him, “Beware that you not speak anything harsh against Jacob.”

verses.name: Genesis 31:25
verses.text: And now Jacob had pitched his tent at the mountain. And when he, with his brothers, had overtaken him, he set his tent at the same place at Mount Gilead.

verses.name: Genesis 31:26
verses.text: And he said to Jacob: “Why have you acted this way, departing from me in secret, with my daughters like captives of the sword?

verses.name: Genesis 31:27
verses.text: Why would you want to flee without my knowledge and without telling me, though I might have led you forward with gladness, and songs, and timbrels, and lyres?

verses.name: Genesis 31:28
verses.text: You have not permitted me to kiss my sons and daughters. You have acted foolishly. And now, indeed,

verses.name: Genesis 31:29
verses.text: my hand has power to repay you with harm. But the God of your father said to me yesterday, ‘Beware that you not speak anything stern against Jacob.’

verses.name: Genesis 31:30
verses.text: It may be that you desired to go to your own, and that you longed for the house of your father. But why have you stolen my gods?”

verses.name: Genesis 31:31
verses.text: Jacob answered: “I set out, unknown to you, because I feared that you might take away your daughters by violence.

verses.name: Genesis 31:32
verses.text: But, since you accuse me of theft, with whomever you will find your gods, let him be slain in the sight of our brothers. Search; anything of yours that you will find with me, take it away.” Now when he said this, he did not know that Rachel had stolen the idols.

verses.name: Genesis 31:33
verses.text: And so Laban, entering the tent of Jacob, and of Leah, and of both the handmaids, did not find them. And when he had entered the tent of Rachel,

verses.name: Genesis 31:34
verses.text: she quickly hid the idols under the camel’s bedding, and she sat upon them. And when he had searched the entire tent and found nothing,

verses.name: Genesis 31:35
verses.text: she said: “Do not be angry, my lord, that I am unable to rise up in your sight, because it has now happened to me according to the custom of women.” So his careful search was thwarted.

verses.name: Genesis 31:36
verses.text: And Jacob, being inflated, said with contention: “For which fault of mine, or for what sin of mine, have you become so enraged against me

verses.name: Genesis 31:37
verses.text: and searched all the items of my house? What have you found from all the substance of your house? Place it here before my brothers, and your brothers, and let them judge between me and you.

verses.name: Genesis 31:38
verses.text: For what reason have I been with you for twenty years? Your ewes and she-goats were not barren; the rams of your flocks I did not consume.

verses.name: Genesis 31:39
verses.text: Neither did I reveal to you what was seized by the wild beast. I replaced all that was damaged. Whatever was lost by theft, you collected it from me.

verses.name: Genesis 31:40
verses.text: Day and night, I was burned by heat and by frost, and sleep fled from my eyes.

verses.name: Genesis 31:41
verses.text: And in this way, for twenty years, I have served you in your house: fourteen for your daughters, and six for your flocks. You have also changed my wages ten times.

verses.name: Genesis 31:42
verses.text: If the God of my father Abraham and the fear of Isaac had not been close to me, perhaps by now you would have sent me away naked. But God looked kindly on my affliction and the labor of my hands, and he rebuked you yesterday.”

verses.name: Genesis 31:43
verses.text: Laban answered him: “My daughters and sons, and your flocks, and all that you discern are mine. What can I do to my sons and grandchildren?

verses.name: Genesis 31:44
verses.text: Come, therefore, let us enter into a pact, so that it may be a testimony between me and you.”

verses.name: Genesis 31:45
verses.text: And so Jacob took a stone, and he set it up as a memorial.

verses.name: Genesis 31:46
verses.text: And he said to his brothers, “Bring stones.” And they, gathering together stones, made a tomb, and they ate upon it.

verses.name: Genesis 31:47
verses.text: And Laban called it, ‘Tomb of Witness,’ and Jacob, ‘Pile of Testimony;’ each of them according to the fitness of his own language.

verses.name: Genesis 31:48
verses.text: And Laban said: “This tomb will be a witness between me and you this day.” (And for this reason, its name has been called Gilead, that is, ‘Tomb of Witness.’)

verses.name: Genesis 31:49
verses.text: “May the Lord consider and judge between us, when we will have withdrawn from one another.

verses.name: Genesis 31:50
verses.text: If you afflict my daughters, and if you bring in other wives over them, no one is a witness of our words except God, who understands beforehand.”

verses.name: Genesis 31:51
verses.text: And again he said to Jacob. “Lo, this tomb and the stone that I have set up between me and you,

verses.name: Genesis 31:52
verses.text: will be a witness. This tomb,” I say, “and the stone, they are for testimony, in case either I cross beyond it going toward you, or you cross beyond it thinking to harm me.

verses.name: Genesis 31:53
verses.text: May the God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge between us.” Therefore, Jacob swore by the fear of his father Isaac.

verses.name: Genesis 31:54
verses.text: And after he had immolated sacrifices on the mountain, he called his brothers to eat bread. And when they had eaten, they lodged there.

verses.name: Genesis 31:55
verses.text: In truth, Laban rose up in the night, and he kissed his sons and daughters, and he blessed them. And he returned to his place.

verses.name: Genesis 32:1
verses.text: Likewise, Jacob continued on the journey that he had begun. And the Angels of God met him.

verses.name: Genesis 32:2
verses.text: When he had seen them, he said, “These are the Encampments of God.” And he called the name of that place Mahanaim, that is, ‘Encampments.’

verses.name: Genesis 32:3
verses.text: Then he also sent messengers before him to his brother Esau, in the land of Seir, in the region of Edom.

verses.name: Genesis 32:4
verses.text: And he instructed them, saying: “You shall speak in this way to my lord Esau: ‘Your brother Jacob says these things: “I have sojourned with Laban, and I have been with him until the present day.

verses.name: Genesis 32:5
verses.text: I have oxen, and donkeys, and sheep, and men servants, and women servants. And now I send an ambassador to my lord, so that I may find favor in your sight.” ’ ”

verses.name: Genesis 32:6
verses.text: And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, “We went to your brother Esau, and behold, he rushes to meet you with four hundred men.”

verses.name: Genesis 32:7
verses.text: Jacob was very afraid. And in his terror, he divided the people who were with him, likewise the flocks, and the sheep, and the oxen, and the camels, into two companies,

verses.name: Genesis 32:8
verses.text: saying: “If Esau goes to one company, and strikes it, the other company, which is left behind, will be saved.”

verses.name: Genesis 32:9
verses.text: And Jacob said: “God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, O Lord who said to me: ‘Return to your land, and to the place of your nativity, and I will do well for you.’

verses.name: Genesis 32:10
verses.text: I am less than any of your compassions and your truth, which you have fulfilled to your servant. With my staff I crossed over this Jordan. And now I go back with two companies.

verses.name: Genesis 32:11
verses.text: Rescue me from the hand of my brother Esau, for I am very afraid of him, lest perhaps he may come and strike down the mother with the sons.

verses.name: Genesis 32:12
