verses.text: You did say that you would do well by me, and that you would expand my offspring like the sand of the sea, which, because of its multitude, cannot be numbered.”

verses.name: Genesis 32:13
verses.text: And when he had slept there that night, he separated, from the things that he had, gifts for his brother Esau:

verses.name: Genesis 32:14
verses.text: two hundred she-goats, twenty he-goats, two hundred ewes, and twenty rams,

verses.name: Genesis 32:15
verses.text: thirty milking camels with their young, forty cows, and twenty bulls, twenty she-donkeys, and ten of their young.

verses.name: Genesis 32:16
verses.text: And he sent them by the hands of his servants, each flock separately, and he said to his servants: “Pass before me, and let there be a space between flock and flock.”

verses.name: Genesis 32:17
verses.text: And he instructed the first, saying: “If you happen to meet my brother Esau, and he questions you: “Whose are you?” or, “Where are you going?” or, “Whose are these which follow you?”

verses.name: Genesis 32:18
verses.text: you shall respond: “Your servant Jacob’s. He has sent them as a gift to my lord Esau. And he is also coming after us.”

verses.name: Genesis 32:19
verses.text: Similarly, he gave orders to the second, and the third, and to all who followed the flocks, saying: “Speak these same words to Esau, when you find him.

verses.name: Genesis 32:20
verses.text: And you will add: ‘Your servant Jacob himself also follows after us, for he said: “I will appease him with the gifts that go ahead, and after this, I will see him; perhaps he will be gracious to me.” ’ ”

verses.name: Genesis 32:21
verses.text: And so the gifts went before him, but he himself lodged that night in the camp.

verses.name: Genesis 32:22
verses.text: And when he had arisen early, he took his two wives, and the same number of handmaids, with his eleven sons, and he crossed over the ford of Jabbok.

verses.name: Genesis 32:23
verses.text: And having delivered over all the things that belonged to him,

verses.name: Genesis 32:24
verses.text: he remained alone. And behold, a man wrestled with him until morning.

verses.name: Genesis 32:25
verses.text: And when he saw that he would not be able to overcome him, he touched the nerve of his thigh, and immediately it withered.

verses.name: Genesis 32:26
verses.text: And he said to him, “Release me, for now the dawn ascends.” He responded, “I will not release you, unless you bless me.”

verses.name: Genesis 32:27
verses.text: Therefore he said, “What is your name?” He answered, “Jacob.”

verses.name: Genesis 32:28
verses.text: But he said, “Your name will not be called Jacob, but Israel; for if you have been strong against God, how much more will you prevail against men?”

verses.name: Genesis 32:29
verses.text: Jacob questioned him, “Tell me, by what name are you called?” He responded, “Why do you ask my name?” And he blessed him in the same place.

verses.name: Genesis 32:30
verses.text: And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel, saying, “I have seen God face to face, and my soul has been saved.”

verses.name: Genesis 32:31
verses.text: And immediately the sun rose upon him, after he had crossed beyond Peniel. Yet in truth, he limped on his foot.

verses.name: Genesis 32:32
verses.text: For this reason, the sons of Israel, even to the present day, do not eat the nerve that withered in Jacob’s thigh, because he touched the nerve of his thigh and it was obstructed.

verses.name: Genesis 33:1
verses.text: Then Jacob, lifting up his eyes, saw Esau arriving, and with him four hundred men. And he divided the sons of Leah and Rachel, and of both the handmaids.

verses.name: Genesis 33:2
verses.text: And he placed the two handmaids and their children at the beginning. Truly, Leah and her sons were in the second place. Then Rachel and Joseph were last.

verses.name: Genesis 33:3
verses.text: And advancing, he reverenced prostrate on the ground seven times, until his brother approached.

verses.name: Genesis 33:4
verses.text: And so Esau ran to meet his brother, and he embraced him. And drawing him by his neck and kissing him, he wept.

verses.name: Genesis 33:5
verses.text: And lifting up his eyes, he saw the women and their little ones, and he said: “What do these want for themselves?” and “Are they related to you?” He responded, “These are the little ones that God has given as a gift to me, your servant.”

verses.name: Genesis 33:6
verses.text: Then the handmaids and their sons approached and bowed down.

verses.name: Genesis 33:7
verses.text: Likewise Leah, with her sons, came near. And when they had reverenced similarly, last of all, Joseph and Rachel reverenced.

verses.name: Genesis 33:8
verses.text: And Esau said, “What are these companies that I have been meeting?” He responded, “So may I find favor before my lord.”

verses.name: Genesis 33:9
verses.text: But he said, “I have plenty, my brother; let these be for yourself.”

verses.name: Genesis 33:10
verses.text: And Jacob said: “I beg you, let it not be so. But if I have found favor in your eyes, receive a small present from my hands. For I have looked upon your face as I would look upon the countenance of God. Be gracious to me,

verses.name: Genesis 33:11
verses.text: and take the blessing which I have brought to you, and which God, who bestows all things, has given as a gift to me.” Accepting it reluctantly, at the insistence of his brother,

verses.name: Genesis 33:12
verses.text: he said, “Let us go on together, and I will accompany you on your journey.”

verses.name: Genesis 33:13
verses.text: And Jacob said: “My lord, you know that I have with me tender little ones, and sheep, and cows with young. If I cause these to labor too much in walking, all the flocks will die in one day.

verses.name: Genesis 33:14
verses.text: May it please my lord to go before his servant. And I will follow gradually in his steps, as much as I see my little ones to be able, until I arrive to my lord in Seir.”

verses.name: Genesis 33:15
verses.text: Esau responded, “I beg you, that at least some of the people who are with me may remain to accompany you on the way.” But he said, “There is no need. I have need of one thing only: to find favor in your sight, my lord.”

verses.name: Genesis 33:16
verses.text: And so Esau returned that day, by the way that he had arrived, to Seir.

verses.name: Genesis 33:17
verses.text: And Jacob went to Succoth, where, having built a house and pitched tents, he called the name of that place Succoth, that is, ‘Tents.’

verses.name: Genesis 33:18
verses.text: And he crossed over to Salem, a city of the Shechemites, which is in the land of Canaan, after he returned from Mesopotamia of Syria. And he lived near the town.

verses.name: Genesis 33:19
verses.text: And he bought the part of the field in which he had pitched his tents from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem, for one hundred lambs.

verses.name: Genesis 33:20
verses.text: And erecting an altar there, he invoked upon it the most strong God of Israel.

verses.name: Genesis 34:1
verses.text: Then Dinah, the daughter of Leah, went out to see the women of that region.

verses.name: Genesis 34:2
verses.text: And when Shechem, the son of Hamor the Hivite, the leader of that land, had seen her, he fell in love with her. And so he seized her and slept with her, overwhelming the virgin by force.

verses.name: Genesis 34:3
verses.text: And his soul was closely bound to her, and, since she was sorrowful, he soothed her with flattery.

verses.name: Genesis 34:4
verses.text: And going on to Hamor, his father, he said, “Obtain this girl for me as a mate.”

verses.name: Genesis 34:5
verses.text: But when Jacob had heard this, since his sons were absent and he was occupied in pasturing the cattle, he remained silent until they came back.

verses.name: Genesis 34:6
verses.text: Then, when Hamor, the father of Shechem, had gone out to speak to Jacob,

verses.name: Genesis 34:7
verses.text: behold, his sons arrived from the field. And hearing what had happened, they were very angry, because he had done a filthy thing in Israel and, in violating a daughter of Jacob, had perpetrated an unlawful act.

verses.name: Genesis 34:8
verses.text: And so Hamor spoke to them: “The soul of my son Shechem has become attached to your daughter. Give her to him as a wife.

verses.name: Genesis 34:9
verses.text: And let us celebrate marriages with one with another. Give us your daughters, and receive our daughters.

verses.name: Genesis 34:10
verses.text: And live with us. The land is in your power: cultivate, trade, and possess it.”

verses.name: Genesis 34:11
verses.text: And Shechem even said to her father and to her brothers: “May I find favor in your sight, and whatever you will appoint, I will give.

verses.name: Genesis 34:12
verses.text: Increase the dowry, and request gifts, and I will freely bestow what you will ask. Only give me this girl as a wife.”

verses.name: Genesis 34:13
verses.text: The sons of Jacob answered Shechem and his father with deceit, being enraged at the rape of their sister:

verses.name: Genesis 34:14
verses.text: “We are not able to do what you ask, nor to give our sister to an uncircumcised man. For us, this is unlawful and abominable.

verses.name: Genesis 34:15
verses.text: But we may succeed in this, so as to be allied with you, if you are willing to become like us, and if all the male sex among you will be circumcised.

verses.name: Genesis 34:16
verses.text: Then we will mutually give and receive your daughters as well as ours; and we will live with you, and we will become one people.

verses.name: Genesis 34:17
verses.text: But if you will not be circumcised, we will take our daughter and withdraw.”

verses.name: Genesis 34:18
verses.text: Their offer pleased Hamor and his son Shechem.

verses.name: Genesis 34:19
verses.text: Neither did the young man cause any delay; in fact he immediately fulfilled what was requested. For he loved the girl very much, and he was well-known throughout his father’s house.

verses.name: Genesis 34:20
verses.text: And entering at the gate of the city, they spoke to the people:

verses.name: Genesis 34:21
verses.text: “These men are peaceful, and they want to live among us. Let them trade in the land and cultivate it, for, being spacious and broad, it is in need of cultivation. We will receive their daughters as wives, and we will give them ours.

verses.name: Genesis 34:22
verses.text: There is one thing that prevents so great a good: whether we will circumcise our males, imitating the ritual of their nation.

verses.name: Genesis 34:23
verses.text: And their substance, and cattle, and all that they possess, will be ours, if only we will acquiesce to this, and so, in living together, will form one people.”

verses.name: Genesis 34:24
verses.text: And they all agreed to circumcise every one of the males.

verses.name: Genesis 34:25
verses.text: And behold, on the third day, when the pain of the wound was greatest, two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, the brothers of Dinah, boldly entered the city with swords. And they put to death all of the males.

verses.name: Genesis 34:26
verses.text: They killed Hamor and Shechem together, taking their sister Dinah from the house of Shechem.

verses.name: Genesis 34:27
verses.text: And when they had departed, the other sons of Jacob rushed over the slain, and they plundered the city in vengeance for the rape.

verses.name: Genesis 34:28
verses.text: Taking their sheep, and herds, and donkeys, and laying waste to everything else that was in their houses and in their fields,

verses.name: Genesis 34:29
verses.text: they also took their little ones and their wives captive.

verses.name: Genesis 34:30
verses.text: When they had boldly completed these acts, Jacob said to Simeon and Levi: “You have troubled me, and you have made me hateful to the Canaanites and the Perizzites, the inhabitants of this land. We are few. They, gathering themselves together, may strike me down, and then both I and my house will be wiped away.”

verses.name: Genesis 34:31
verses.text: They responded, “Should they abuse our sister like a prostitute?”

verses.name: Genesis 35:1
verses.text: About this time, God said to Jacob, “Arise and go up to Bethel, and live there, and make an altar to God, who appeared to you when you fled from your brother Esau.”

verses.name: Genesis 35:2
verses.text: In truth, Jacob, having called together all his house, said: “Cast away the foreign gods that are in your midst and be cleansed, and also change your garments.

verses.name: Genesis 35:3
verses.text: Arise, and let us go up to Bethel, so that we may make an altar there to God, who heeded me in the day of my tribulation, and who accompanied me on my journey.”

verses.name: Genesis 35:4
verses.text: Therefore, they gave him all the foreign gods which they had, and the earrings which were in their ears. And then he buried them under the terebinth tree, which is beyond the city of Shechem.

verses.name: Genesis 35:5
verses.text: And when they had set out, the terror of God invaded all the surrounding cities, and they dared not pursue them as they withdrew.

verses.name: Genesis 35:6
verses.text: And so, Jacob arrived at Luz, which is in the land of Canaan, also named Bethel: he and all the people with him.

verses.name: Genesis 35:7
verses.text: And he built an altar there, and he called the name of that place, ‘House of God.’ For there, God appeared to him when he fled from his brother.

verses.name: Genesis 35:8
verses.text: About the same time, Deborah, the nurse of Rebekah, died, and she was buried at the base of Bethel, under an oak tree. And the name of that place was called, ‘Oak of Weeping.’

verses.name: Genesis 35:9
verses.text: Then God appeared again to Jacob, after he returned from Mesopotamia of Syria, and he blessed him,

verses.name: Genesis 35:10
verses.text: saying: “You will no longer be called Jacob, for your name shall be Israel.” And he called him Israel,

verses.name: Genesis 35:11
verses.text: and he said to him: “I am Almighty God: increase and multiply. Tribes and peoples of nations will be from you, and kings will go forth from your loins.

verses.name: Genesis 35:12
verses.text: And the land that I gave to Abraham and Isaac, I will give to you, and to your offspring after you.”

verses.name: Genesis 35:13
verses.text: And he withdrew from him.

verses.name: Genesis 35:14
verses.text: In truth, he set up a monument of stone, in the place where God had spoken to him, pouring out libations over it, and pouring oil,

verses.name: Genesis 35:15
verses.text: and he called the name of that place, ‘Bethel.’

verses.name: Genesis 35:16
verses.text: Then, departing from there, he arrived in springtime at the land that leads to Ephrath. And there, when Rachel was giving birth,

verses.name: Genesis 35:17
verses.text: because it was a difficult birth, she began to be in danger. And the midwife said to her, “Do not be afraid, for you will have this son also.”

verses.name: Genesis 35:18
verses.text: Then, when her life was departing because of the pain, and death was now imminent, she called the name of her son Benoni, that is, the son of my pain. Yet truly, his father called him Benjamin, that is, the son of the right hand.

verses.name: Genesis 35:19
verses.text: And so Rachel died, and she was buried in the way that leads to Ephrath: this place is Bethlehem.

verses.name: Genesis 35:20
verses.text: And Jacob erected a monument over her sepulcher. This is the monument to Rachel’s tomb, even to the present day.

verses.name: Genesis 35:21
verses.text: Departing from there, he pitched his tent beyond the Tower of the Flock.

verses.name: Genesis 35:22
verses.text: And when he was living in that region, Reuben went out, and he slept with Bilhah the concubine of his father, which was not such a small matter as to be hidden from him. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve.

verses.name: Genesis 35:23
verses.text: The sons of Leah: Reuben the first born, and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun.

verses.name: Genesis 35:24
verses.text: The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.

verses.name: Genesis 35:25
verses.text: The sons of Bilhah, handmaid of Rachel: Dan and Naphtali.

verses.name: Genesis 35:26
verses.text: The sons of Zilpah, handmaid of Leah: Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob, who were born to him in Mesopotamia of Syria.

verses.name: Genesis 35:27
verses.text: And then he went to his father Isaac in Mamre, the city of Arba: this place is Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.

verses.name: Genesis 35:28
verses.text: And the days of Isaac were completed: one hundred and eighty years.

verses.name: Genesis 35:29
verses.text: And being consumed by old age, he died. And he was placed with his people, being old and full of days. And his sons, Esau and Jacob, buried him.

verses.name: Genesis 36:1
verses.text: Now these are the generations of Esau, who is Edom.

verses.name: Genesis 36:2
verses.text: Esau took wives from the daughters of Canaan: Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Oholibamah the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite,

verses.name: Genesis 36:3
verses.text: and Basemath, the daughter of Ishmael, sister of Nebaioth.

verses.name: Genesis 36:4
verses.text: Then Adah bore Eliphaz. Basemath conceived Reuel.

verses.name: Genesis 36:5
verses.text: Oholibamah conceived Jeush, and Jalam, and Korah. These are the sons of Esau, who were born to him in the land of Canaan.

verses.name: Genesis 36:6
verses.text: Then Esau took his wives, and sons, and daughters, and every soul of his house, and his substance, and cattle, and whatever he was able to obtain in the land of Canaan, and he went into another region, withdrawing from his brother Jacob.

verses.name: Genesis 36:7
verses.text: For they were very wealthy and were not able to live together. Neither was the land of their sojourn able to sustain them, because of the multitude of their flocks.

verses.name: Genesis 36:8
verses.text: And Esau lived at mount Seir: he is Edom.

verses.name: Genesis 36:9
verses.text: So these are the generations of Esau, the father of Edom, at mount Seir,

verses.name: Genesis 36:10
verses.text: and these are the names of his sons: Eliphaz the son of Adah, the wife of Esau, likewise Reuel, the son of Basemath, his wife.

verses.name: Genesis 36:11
verses.text: And Eliphaz had sons: Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenez.

verses.name: Genesis 36:12
verses.text: Now Timna was the concubine of Eliphaz, the son of Esau. And she bore him Amalek. These are the sons of Adah, the wife of Esau.

verses.name: Genesis 36:13
verses.text: And the sons of Reuel were Nahath and Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah. These are the sons of Basemath, the wife of Esau.

verses.name: Genesis 36:14
verses.text: Likewise, these were the sons of Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon, the wife of Esau, whom she bore to him: Jeush, and Jalam, and Korah.

verses.name: Genesis 36:15
verses.text: These were leaders of the sons of Esau, the sons of Eliphaz, the firstborn of Esau: leader Teman, leader Omar, leader Zepho, leader Kenez,

verses.name: Genesis 36:16
verses.text: leader Korah, leader Gatam, leader Amalek. These are the sons of Eliphaz, in the land of Edom, and these the sons of Adah.

verses.name: Genesis 36:17
verses.text: Likewise, these are the sons of Reuel, the son of Esau: leader Nahath, leader Zerah, leader Shammah, leader Mizzah. And these were the leaders of Reuel, in the land of Edom. These are the sons of Basemath, the wife of Esau.

verses.name: Genesis 36:18
verses.text: Now these are the sons of Oholibamah, the wife of Esau: leader Jeush, leader Jalam, leader Korah. These were the leaders of Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah and the wife of Esau.

verses.name: Genesis 36:19
verses.text: These are the sons of Esau, and these were their leaders: this is Edom.

verses.name: Genesis 36:20
verses.text: These are the sons of Seir, the Horite, the inhabitants of the land: Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah,

verses.name: Genesis 36:21
verses.text: and Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan. These were the leaders of the Horites, the sons of Seir, in the land of Edom.

verses.name: Genesis 36:22
verses.text: Now Lotan produced sons: Hori and Heman. But the sister of Lotan was Timna.

verses.name: Genesis 36:23
verses.text: And these are the sons of Shobal: Alvan, and Manahath, and Ebal, and Shepho, and Onam.

verses.name: Genesis 36:24
verses.text: And these are the sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah. This is the Anah who found the hot springs in the wilderness, when he was pasturing the donkeys of his father Zibeon.

verses.name: Genesis 36:25
verses.text: And he had a son Dishon, and a daughter Oholibamah.

verses.name: Genesis 36:26
verses.text: And these are the sons of Dishon: Hemdan, and Esheban, and Ithran, and Cheran.

verses.name: Genesis 36:27
verses.text: Likewise, these are the sons of Ezer: Bilhan, and Zaavan, and Akan.

verses.name: Genesis 36:28
verses.text: Then Dishan had sons: Uz and Aran.

verses.name: Genesis 36:29
verses.text: These were the leaders of the Horites: leader Lotan, leader Shobal, leader Zibeon, leader Anah,

verses.name: Genesis 36:30
verses.text: leader Dishon, leader Ezer, leader Disan. These were leaders of the Horites who ruled in the land of Seir.

verses.name: Genesis 36:31
verses.text: Now before the sons of Israel had a king, the kings who ruled in the land of Edom were these:

verses.name: Genesis 36:32
verses.text: Bela the son of Beor, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

verses.name: Genesis 36:33
verses.text: Then Bela died, and Jobab, the son of Zerah from Bozrah, reigned in his place.

verses.name: Genesis 36:34
verses.text: And when Jobab was dead, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.

verses.name: Genesis 36:35
verses.text: Likewise, this one having died, Hadad the son of Bedad reigned in his place. He struck down Midian in the region of Moab. And the name of his city was Avith.

verses.name: Genesis 36:36
verses.text: And when Adad was dead, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.

verses.name: Genesis 36:37
verses.text: Likewise, this one being dead, Shaul of the river Rehoboth, reigned in his place.

verses.name: Genesis 36:38
verses.text: And when he also had passed away, Baal-hanan, the son of Achbor, succeeded to the kingdom.

verses.name: Genesis 36:39
verses.text: Likewise, this one being dead, Hadar reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Pau. And his wife was called Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, daughter of Mezahab.

verses.name: Genesis 36:40
verses.text: Therefore, these were the names of the leaders of Esau, by their families, and places, and in their vocabulary: leader Timna, leader Alvah, leader Jetheth,

verses.name: Genesis 36:41
verses.text: leader Oholibamah, leader Elah, leader Pinon,

verses.name: Genesis 36:42
verses.text: leader Kanez, leader Teman, leader Mibzar,

verses.name: Genesis 36:43
verses.text: leader Magdiel, leader Iram. These were the leaders of Edom living in the land of their rule: this is Esau, the father of Idumea.

verses.name: Genesis 37:1
verses.text: Now Jacob lived in the land of Canaan, where his father sojourned.

verses.name: Genesis 37:2
verses.text: And these are his generations. Joseph, when he was sixteen years old, was pasturing the flock with his brothers, when he was still a boy. And he was with the sons of Bilhah and Zilpah, the wives of his father. And he accused his brothers to their father of a most sinful crime.

verses.name: Genesis 37:3
verses.text: Now Israel loved Joseph above all his sons, because he had conceived him in his old age. And he made him a tunic, woven of many colors.

verses.name: Genesis 37:4
verses.text: Then his brothers, seeing that he was loved by his father more than all his other sons, hated him, and they were not able to say anything peacefully to him.

verses.name: Genesis 37:5
verses.text: Then it also happened that he recounted the vision of a dream to his brothers, for which reason a greater hatred began to be nurtured.

verses.name: Genesis 37:6
verses.text: And he said to them, “Listen to my dream that I saw.

verses.name: Genesis 37:7
verses.text: I thought we were binding sheaves in the field. And my sheaf seemed to rise up and stand, and your sheaves, standing in a circle, reverenced my sheaf.”

verses.name: Genesis 37:8
verses.text: His brothers responded: “Would you be our king? Or will we be subject to your dominion?” Therefore, this matter of his dreams and words provided kindling to their envy and hatred.

verses.name: Genesis 37:9
verses.text: Likewise, he saw another dream, which he explained to his brothers, saying, “I saw by a dream, as if the sun, and the moon, and eleven stars were reverencing me.”

verses.name: Genesis 37:10
verses.text: And when he had related this to his father and brothers, his father rebuked him, and he said: “What does it mean to you, this dream that you have seen? Should I, and your mother, and your brothers reverence you upon the earth?”

verses.name: Genesis 37:11
verses.text: Therefore, his brothers were envious of him. Yet truly, his father considered the matter silently.

verses.name: Genesis 37:12
verses.text: And while his brothers were lodging at Shechem, pasturing their father’s flocks,

verses.name: Genesis 37:13
verses.text: Israel said to him: “Your brothers are pasturing the sheep at Shechem. Come, I will send you to them.” And when he answered,

verses.name: Genesis 37:14
verses.text: “I am ready,” he said to him, “Go, and see if everything is prospering with your brothers and the cattle, and report to me what is happening.” So, having been sent from the valley of Hebron, he arrived at Shechem.

verses.name: Genesis 37:15
verses.text: And a man found him wandering in a field, and he asked him what he was seeking.

verses.name: Genesis 37:16
verses.text: So he responded: “I seek my brothers. Tell me where they pasture the flocks.”

verses.name: Genesis 37:17
verses.text: And the man said to him: “They have withdrawn from this place. But I heard them saying, ‘Let us go to Dothan.’ ” Therefore, Joseph continued on after his brothers, and he found them at Dothan.

verses.name: Genesis 37:18
verses.text: And, when they had seen him from afar, before he approached them, they decided to kill him.

verses.name: Genesis 37:19
verses.text: And they said one to another: “Behold, the dreamer approaches.

verses.name: Genesis 37:20
verses.text: Come, let us kill him and cast him into the old cistern. And let us say: ‘an evil wild beast has devoured him.’ And then it will become apparent what his dreams will do for him.”

verses.name: Genesis 37:21
verses.text: But Reuben, on hearing this, strove to free him from their hands, and he said:

verses.name: Genesis 37:22
verses.text: “Do not take away his life, nor shed blood. But throw him into this cistern, which is in the wilderness, and so keep your hands harmless.” But he said this, wanting to rescue him from their hands, so as to return him to his father.

verses.name: Genesis 37:23
verses.text: And so, as soon as he came to his brothers, they very quickly stripped him of his tunic, which was ankle-length and woven of many colors,

verses.name: Genesis 37:24
verses.text: and they cast him into an old cistern, which held no water.

verses.name: Genesis 37:25
verses.text: And sitting down to eat bread, they saw some Ishmaelites, travelers coming from Gilead, with their camels, carrying spices, and resin, and oil of myrrh into Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 37:26
verses.text: Therefore, Judah said to his brothers: “What will it profit us, if we kill our brother and conceal his blood?

verses.name: Genesis 37:27
verses.text: It is better that he be sold to the Ishmaelites, and then our hands will not be defiled. For he is our brother and our flesh.” His brothers agreed to his words.

verses.name: Genesis 37:28
verses.text: And when the Midianite merchants were passing by, they drew him from the cistern, and they sold him to the Ishmaelites for twenty pieces of silver. And these led him into Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 37:29
verses.text: And Reuben, returning to the cistern, did not find the boy.

verses.name: Genesis 37:30
verses.text: And rending his garments, he went to his brothers and said, “The boy is not present, and so where shall I go?”

verses.name: Genesis 37:31
verses.text: Then they took his tunic, and they dipped it in the blood of a young goat, which they had killed,

verses.name: Genesis 37:32
verses.text: sending those who carried it to their father, and they said: “We found this. See whether it is the tunic of your son or not.”

verses.name: Genesis 37:33
verses.text: And when the father acknowledged it, he said: “It is the tunic of my son. An evil wild beast has eaten him; a beast has devoured Joseph.”

verses.name: Genesis 37:34
verses.text: And tearing his garments, he was clothed in haircloth, mourning his son for a long time.

verses.name: Genesis 37:35
verses.text: Then, when all of his sons gathered together to ease their father’s sorrow, he was not willing to accept consolation, but he said: “I will descend in mourning to my son in the underworld.” And while he persevered in weeping,

verses.name: Genesis 37:36
verses.text: the Midianites in Egypt sold Joseph to Potiphar, a eunuch of Pharaoh, instructor of the soldiers.

verses.name: Genesis 38:1
verses.text: About the same time, Judah, descending from his brothers, turned toward an Adullamite man, named Hirah.

verses.name: Genesis 38:2
verses.text: And he saw there the daughter of a man called Shua, of Canaan. And taking her as a wife, he entered to her.

verses.name: Genesis 38:3
verses.text: And she conceived and bore a son, and she called his name Er.

verses.name: Genesis 38:4
verses.text: And conceiving offspring again, having given birth to a son, she called him Onan.

verses.name: Genesis 38:5
verses.text: Likewise, she bore a third, whom she called Shelah, after whose birth, she ceased to bear any more.

verses.name: Genesis 38:6
verses.text: Then Judah gave a wife to his first born Er, whose name was Tamar.

verses.name: Genesis 38:7
verses.text: And it also happened that Er, the first born of Judah, was wicked in the sight of the Lord and was killed by him.

verses.name: Genesis 38:8
verses.text: Therefore, Judah said to his son Onan: “Enter to the wife of your brother, and associate with her, so that you may raise offspring to your brother.”

verses.name: Genesis 38:9
verses.text: He, knowing that the sons to be born would not be his, when he entered to the wife of his brother, he spilled his seed on the ground, lest children should be born in his brother’s name.

verses.name: Genesis 38:10
verses.text: And for this reason, the Lord struck him down, because he did a detestable thing.

verses.name: Genesis 38:11
verses.text: Because of this matter, Judah said to his daughter-in-law Tamar, “Be a widow in your father’s house, until my son Shelah grows up.” For he was afraid, lest he also might die, just as his brothers did. She went away, and she lived in her father’s house.

verses.name: Genesis 38:12
verses.text: Then, after many days had passed, the daughter of Shua, the wife of Judah, died. And when he accepted consolation after his mourning, he went up to the shearers of his sheep at Timnah, he and Hirah, the herdsman of the Adullamite flock.

verses.name: Genesis 38:13
verses.text: And it was reported to Tamar that her father-in-law had gone up to Timnah to shear the sheep.

verses.name: Genesis 38:14
verses.text: And storing away the garments of her widowhood, she took up a veil. And changing her clothing, she sat at the crossroad that leads to Timnah, because Shelah had grown up, and she had not received him as a husband.

verses.name: Genesis 38:15
verses.text: And when Judah saw her, he thought her to be a harlot. For she had covered her face, lest she be recognized.

verses.name: Genesis 38:16
verses.text: And entering to her, he said, “Permit me to join with you.” For he did not know her to be his daughter-in-law. And she responded, “What will you give to me, to enjoy me as a concubine?”

verses.name: Genesis 38:17
verses.text: He said, “I will send you a young goat from the flock.” And again, she said, “I will allow what you want, if you give me a pledge, until you may send what you promise.”

verses.name: Genesis 38:18
verses.text: Judah said, “What do you want to be given for a pledge?” She responded, “Your ring and bracelet, and the staff that you hold in your hand.” Thereupon, the woman, from one sexual encounter, conceived.

verses.name: Genesis 38:19
verses.text: And she arose and went away. And storing away the garments that she had taken up, she was clothed in the garments of her widowhood.

verses.name: Genesis 38:20
verses.text: Then Judah sent a young goat by his shepherd, the Adullamite, so that he might receive the pledge that he had given to the woman. But, when he had not found her,

verses.name: Genesis 38:21
verses.text: he questioned the men of that place: “Where is the woman who sat at the crossroad?” And they all responded, “There has been no harlot in this place.”

verses.name: Genesis 38:22
verses.text: He returned to Judah, and he said to him: “I did not find her. Moreover, the men of that place told me that a prostitute had never sat there.”

verses.name: Genesis 38:23
verses.text: Judah said: “Let her hold herself to blame. Certainly, she is not able to accuse us of a lie. I sent the young goat that I had promised, and you did not find her.”

verses.name: Genesis 38:24
verses.text: And behold, after three months, they reported to Judah, saying, “Tamar, your daughter-in-law, has committed fornication and her abdomen appears to be enlarged.” And Judah said, “Produce her, so that she may be burned.”

verses.name: Genesis 38:25
verses.text: But when she was led out to the punishment, she sent to her father-in-law, saying: “I conceived by the man to whom these things belong. Recognize whose ring, and bracelet, and staff this is.”

verses.name: Genesis 38:26
verses.text: But he, acknowledging the gifts, said: “She is more just than I am. For I did not deliver her to my son Shelah.” However, he knew her no more.

verses.name: Genesis 38:27
verses.text: Then, at the moment of birth, there appeared twins in the womb. And so, in the very delivery of the infants, one put forth a hand, on which the midwife tied a scarlet thread, saying,

verses.name: Genesis 38:28
verses.text: “This one will go out first.”

verses.name: Genesis 38:29
verses.text: But in truth, drawing back his hand, the other came out. And the woman said, “Why is the partition divided for you?” And for this reason, she called his name Perez.

verses.name: Genesis 38:30
verses.text: After this, his brother came out, on whose hand was the scarlet thread. And she called him Zerah.

verses.name: Genesis 39:1
verses.text: Meanwhile, Joseph was led into Egypt. And Putiphar, a eunuch of Pharaoh, a leader of the army, an Egyptian man, purchased him from the hand of the Ishmaelites, by whom he was brought.

verses.name: Genesis 39:2
verses.text: And the Lord was with him, and he was a man who prospered in everything that he did. And he lived in the house of his lord,

verses.name: Genesis 39:3
verses.text: who knew very well that the Lord was with him, and that all the things that were done by him were directed by his hand.

verses.name: Genesis 39:4
verses.text: And Joseph found favor in the sight of his lord, and he ministered to him. And, having been placed in charge of everything by him, he governed the house that was entrusted to him and all the things that had been delivered to him.

verses.name: Genesis 39:5
verses.text: And the Lord blessed the house of the Egyptian, because of Joseph, and he multiplied all his substance, as much in the buildings, as in the fields.

verses.name: Genesis 39:6
verses.text: Neither did he know anything other than the bread that he ate. Now Joseph was beautiful in form, and stately in appearance.

verses.name: Genesis 39:7
verses.text: And so, after many days, his mistress cast her eyes on Joseph, and she said, “Sleep with me.”

verses.name: Genesis 39:8
verses.text: And without consenting at all to the wicked act, he said to her: “Behold, my lord has delivered all things to me, and he does not know what he has in his own house.

verses.name: Genesis 39:9
verses.text: Neither is there anything which is not in my power, or that he has not delivered to me, except you, for you are his wife. How then can I do this evil act and sin against my God?”

verses.name: Genesis 39:10
verses.text: With such words as these, throughout each day, the woman was pestering the young man, and he was refusing the adultery.

verses.name: Genesis 39:11
verses.text: Then it happened, on a certain day, that Joseph entered the house, and he was doing something, without any witnesses.

verses.name: Genesis 39:12
verses.text: And she, grasping the hem of his garment, said, “Sleep with me.” But he, leaving behind the cloak in her hand, fled and went outside.

verses.name: Genesis 39:13
verses.text: And when the woman saw the garment in her hands and herself being treated with disrespect,

verses.name: Genesis 39:14
verses.text: she called to herself the men of her house, and she said to them: “Lo, he has brought in a Hebrew man to abuse us. He entered toward me, in order to join with me; and when I had shouted out,

verses.name: Genesis 39:15
verses.text: and he had heard my voice, he left behind the cloak that I held, and he fled outside.”

verses.name: Genesis 39:16
verses.text: As a proof, therefore, of her fidelity, she retained the cloak, and she showed it to her husband, when he returned home.

verses.name: Genesis 39:17
verses.text: And she said: “The Hebrew servant, whom you have brought in to me, approached me to abuse me.

verses.name: Genesis 39:18
verses.text: And when he had heard me cry out, he left behind the cloak that I held, and he fled outside.”

verses.name: Genesis 39:19
verses.text: His lord, upon hearing these things, and having excessive trust in the words of his mate, was very angry.

verses.name: Genesis 39:20
verses.text: And he delivered Joseph into prison, where the prisoners of the king were kept, and he was enclosed in that place.

verses.name: Genesis 39:21
verses.text: But the Lord was with Joseph, and, having mercy on him, he gave him favor in the sight of the leader of the prison,

verses.name: Genesis 39:22
verses.text: who delivered into his hand all the prisoners who were held in custody. And whatever was done, was under him.

verses.name: Genesis 39:23
verses.text: Neither did he himself know anything, having entrusted all things to him. For the Lord was with him, and he directed everything that he did.

verses.name: Genesis 40:1
verses.text: While these things were going on, it happened that two eunuchs, the cupbearer of the king of Egypt, and the miller of grain, offended their lord.

verses.name: Genesis 40:2
verses.text: And Pharaoh, being angry with them, (now the one was in charge of the cupbearers, the other of the millers of grain)

verses.name: Genesis 40:3
verses.text: sent them to the prison of the leader of the military, in which Joseph also was a prisoner.

verses.name: Genesis 40:4
verses.text: But the keeper of the prison delivered them to Joseph, who ministered to them also. Some little time passed by, while they were held in custody.

verses.name: Genesis 40:5
verses.text: And they both saw a similar dream on one night, whose interpretations should be related to one another.

verses.name: Genesis 40:6
verses.text: And when Joseph had entered to them in the morning, and had seen them sad,

verses.name: Genesis 40:7
verses.text: he consulted them, saying, “Why is your expression sadder today than usual?”

verses.name: Genesis 40:8
verses.text: They responded, “We have seen a dream, and there is no one to interpret it for us.” And Joseph said to them, “Doesn’t interpretation belong to God? Recount for me what you have seen.”

verses.name: Genesis 40:9
verses.text: The chief cupbearer explained his dream first. “I saw before me a vine,

verses.name: Genesis 40:10
verses.text: on which were three shoots, which grew little by little into buds, and, after the flowers, it matured into grapes.

verses.name: Genesis 40:11
verses.text: And the cup of Pharaoh was in my hand. Therefore, I took the grapes, and I pressed them into the cup that I held, and I handed the cup to Pharaoh.”

verses.name: Genesis 40:12
verses.text: Joseph responded: “This is the interpretation of the dream. The three shoots are the next three days,

verses.name: Genesis 40:13
verses.text: after which Pharaoh will remember your service, and he will restore you to your former position. And you will give him the cup according to your office, as you were accustomed to do before.

verses.name: Genesis 40:14
verses.text: Only remember me, when it will be well with you, and do me this mercy, to suggest to Pharaoh to lead me out of this prison.

verses.name: Genesis 40:15
verses.text: For I have been stolen from the land of the Hebrews, and here, innocently, I was cast into the pit.”

verses.name: Genesis 40:16
verses.text: The chief miller of grain, seeing that he had wisely unraveled the dream, said: “I also saw a dream: that I had three baskets of meal above my head,

verses.name: Genesis 40:17
verses.text: and in one basket, which was the highest, I carried all foods that are made by the art of baking, and the birds ate from it.”

verses.name: Genesis 40:18
verses.text: Joseph responded: “This is the interpretation of the dream. The three baskets are the next three days,

verses.name: Genesis 40:19
verses.text: after which Pharaoh will carry away your head, and also suspend you from a cross, and the birds will tear your flesh.”

verses.name: Genesis 40:20
verses.text: The third day thereafter was the birthday of Pharaoh. And making a great feast for his servants, he remembered, during the banquet, the chief cupbearer and the chief miller of grain.

verses.name: Genesis 40:21
verses.text: And he restored the one to his place, to present him the cup;

verses.name: Genesis 40:22
verses.text: the other he hanged on a gallows, and thus the truth of the interpreter of dreams was proven.

verses.name: Genesis 40:23
verses.text: And although he advanced with so much prosperity, the chief cupbearer forgot his interpreter of dreams.

verses.name: Genesis 41:1
verses.text: After two years, Pharaoh saw a dream. He thought himself to be standing above a river,

verses.name: Genesis 41:2
verses.text: from which ascended seven cows, exceedingly beautiful and stout. And they pastured in marshy places.

verses.name: Genesis 41:3
verses.text: Likewise, another seven emerged from the river, filthy and thoroughly emaciated. And they pastured on the same bank of the river, in green places.

verses.name: Genesis 41:4
verses.text: And they devoured those whose appearance and condition of body was so wonderful. Pharaoh, having been awakened,

verses.name: Genesis 41:5
verses.text: slept again, and he saw another dream. Seven ears of grain sprung up on one stalk, full and well-formed.

verses.name: Genesis 41:6
verses.text: Likewise, other ears of grain, of the same number, rose up, thin and struck with blight,

verses.name: Genesis 41:7
verses.text: devouring all the beauty of the first. Pharaoh, when he awakened after his rest,

verses.name: Genesis 41:8
verses.text: and when morning arrived, being terrified with fear, sent to all the interpreters of Egypt and to all of the wise men. And when they were summoned, he explained to them his dream; but there was no one who could interpret it.

verses.name: Genesis 41:9
verses.text: Then at last the chief cupbearer, remembering, said, “I confess my sin.

verses.name: Genesis 41:10
verses.text: The king, being angry with his servants, ordered me and the chief miller of grain to be forced into the prison of the leader of the military.

verses.name: Genesis 41:11
verses.text: There, in one night, both of us saw a dream presaging the future.

verses.name: Genesis 41:12
verses.text: In that place, there was a Hebrew, a servant of the same commander of the military, to whom we explained our dreams.

verses.name: Genesis 41:13
verses.text: Whatever we heard was proven afterwards by the event of the matter. For I was restored to my office, and he was suspended on a cross.”

verses.name: Genesis 41:14
verses.text: Immediately, by the king’s authority, Joseph was led out of prison, and they shaved him. And changing his apparel, they presented him to him.

verses.name: Genesis 41:15
verses.text: And he said to him, “I have seen dreams, and there is no one who can unfold them. I have heard that you are very wise at interpreting these.”

verses.name: Genesis 41:16
verses.text: Joseph responded, “Apart from me, God will respond favorably to Pharaoh.”

verses.name: Genesis 41:17
verses.text: Therefore, Pharaoh explained what he had seen: “I thought myself to be standing on the bank of a river,

verses.name: Genesis 41:18
verses.text: and seven cows climbed up from the river, exceedingly beautiful and full of flesh. And they grazed in a pasture of a marshy greenery.

verses.name: Genesis 41:19
verses.text: And behold, there followed after these, another seven cows, with such deformity and emaciation as I had never seen in the land of Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 41:20
verses.text: These devoured and consumed the first,

verses.name: Genesis 41:21
verses.text: giving no indication of being full. But they remained in the same state of emaciation and squalor. Awakening, but being weighed down into sleep again,

verses.name: Genesis 41:22
verses.text: I saw a dream. Seven ears of grain sprang up on one stalk, full and very beautiful.

verses.name: Genesis 41:23
verses.text: Likewise, another seven, thin and struck with blight, rose up from the stalk.

verses.name: Genesis 41:24
verses.text: And they devoured the beauty of the first. I explained this dream to the interpreters, and there is no one who can unfold it.”

verses.name: Genesis 41:25
verses.text: Joseph responded: “The dream of the king is one. What God will do, he has revealed to Pharaoh.

verses.name: Genesis 41:26
verses.text: The seven beautiful cows, and the seven full ears of grain, are seven years of abundance. And so the force of the dreams is understood to be the same.

verses.name: Genesis 41:27
verses.text: Likewise, the seven thin and emaciated cows, which ascended after them, and the seven thin ears of grain, which were struck with the burning wind, are seven approaching years of famine.

verses.name: Genesis 41:28
verses.text: These will be fulfilled in this order.

verses.name: Genesis 41:29
verses.text: Behold, there will arrive seven years of great fertility throughout the entire land of Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 41:30
verses.text: After this, there will follow another seven years, of such great barrenness that all the former abundance will be delivered into oblivion. For the famine will consume all the land,

verses.name: Genesis 41:31
verses.text: and the greatness of this destitution will cause the greatness of the abundance to be lost.

verses.name: Genesis 41:32
verses.text: Now, as to what you saw the second time, it is a dream pertaining to the same thing. It is an indication of its firmness, because the word of God shall be done, and it shall be completed swiftly.

verses.name: Genesis 41:33
verses.text: Now therefore, let the king provide a wise and industrious man, and place him over the land of Egypt,

verses.name: Genesis 41:34
verses.text: so that he may appoint overseers throughout all the regions. And let a fifth part of the fruits, throughout the seven fertile years

verses.name: Genesis 41:35
verses.text: that now have already begun to occur, be gathered into storehouses. And let all the grain be stored away, under the power of Pharaoh, and let it be kept in the cities.

verses.name: Genesis 41:36
verses.text: And let it be prepared for the future famine of seven years, which will oppress Egypt, and then the land will not be consumed by destitution.”

verses.name: Genesis 41:37
verses.text: The counsel pleased Pharaoh and all his ministers.

verses.name: Genesis 41:38
verses.text: And he said to them, “Would we be able to find another such man, who is full of the Spirit of God?”

verses.name: Genesis 41:39
verses.text: Therefore, he said to Joseph: “Because God has revealed to you all that you have said, would I be able to find anyone wiser and as much like you?

verses.name: Genesis 41:40
verses.text: You will be over my house, and to the authority of your mouth, all the people will show obedience. Only in one way, in the throne of the kingdom, will I go before you.”

verses.name: Genesis 41:41
verses.text: And again, Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Behold, I have appointed you over the entire land of Egypt.”

verses.name: Genesis 41:42
verses.text: And he took the ring from his own hand, and he gave it into his hand. And he clothed him with a robe of fine linen, and he placed a necklace of gold around his neck.

verses.name: Genesis 41:43
verses.text: And he caused him to ascend upon his second swift chariot, with the herald proclaiming that everyone should bend their knee before him, and that they should know that he was governor over the entire land of Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 41:44
verses.text: Likewise, the king said to Joseph: “I am Pharaoh: apart from your authority, no one will move hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.”

verses.name: Genesis 41:45
verses.text: And he changed his name and called him, in the Egyptian tongue: ‘Savior of the world.’ And he gave him as a wife, Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera, priest of Heliopolis. And so Joseph went out into the land of Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 41:46
verses.text: (Now he was thirty years old when he stood in the sight of king Pharaoh.) And he traveled throughout the regions of Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 41:47
verses.text: And the fertility of the seven years arrived. And when the grain fields were reduced to sheaves, these were gathered into the storehouses of Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 41:48
verses.text: And now all the abundance of grain was stored away in every city.

verses.name: Genesis 41:49
verses.text: And there was such a great abundance of wheat that it was comparable to the sands of the sea, and its bounty exceeded all measure.

verses.name: Genesis 41:50
verses.text: Then, before the famine arrived, Joseph had two sons born, whom Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera, priest of Heliopolis, bore for him.

verses.name: Genesis 41:51
verses.text: And he called the name of the firstborn Manasseh, saying, “God has caused me to forget all my labors and the house of my father.”

verses.name: Genesis 41:52
verses.text: Likewise, he named the second Ephraim, saying, “God has caused me to increase in the land of my poverty.”

verses.name: Genesis 41:53
verses.text: And so, when the seven years of fertility that occurred in Egypt had passed,

verses.name: Genesis 41:54
verses.text: the seven years of destitution, which Joseph had predicted, began to arrive. And the famine prevailed throughout the whole world, but there was bread in all the land of Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 41:55
verses.text: And being hungry, the people cried out to Pharaoh, asking for provisions. And he said to them: “Go to Joseph. And do whatever he will tell you.”

verses.name: Genesis 41:56
verses.text: Then the famine increased daily in all the land. And Joseph opened all of the storehouses and sold to the Egyptians. For the famine had oppressed them also.

verses.name: Genesis 41:57
verses.text: And all the provinces came to Egypt, to buy food and to temper the misfortune of their destitution.

verses.name: Genesis 42:1
verses.text: Then Jacob, hearing that food was being sold in Egypt, said to his sons: “Why are you negligent?

verses.name: Genesis 42:2
verses.text: I have heard that wheat is being sold in Egypt. Go down and buy necessities for us, so that we may be able to live, and not be consumed by destitution.”

verses.name: Genesis 42:3
verses.text: And so, when ten brothers of Joseph went down to buy grain in Egypt,

verses.name: Genesis 42:4
verses.text: Benjamin was kept at home by Jacob, who said to his brothers, “Lest perhaps he may suffer harm on the journey.”

verses.name: Genesis 42:5
verses.text: And they entered into the land of Egypt with the others who traveled to buy. For the famine was in the land of Canaan.

verses.name: Genesis 42:6
verses.text: And Joseph was governor in the land of Egypt, and grain was sold under his direction to the people. And when his brothers had reverenced him

verses.name: Genesis 42:7
verses.text: and he had recognized them, he spoke harshly, as if to foreigners, questioning them: “Where did you come from?” And they responded, “From the land of Canaan, to buy necessary provisions.”

verses.name: Genesis 42:8
verses.text: And although he knew his brothers, he was not known by them.

verses.name: Genesis 42:9
verses.text: And remembering the dreams, which he had seen in another time, he said to them: “You are scouts. You have come in order to see which parts of the land are weaker.”

verses.name: Genesis 42:10
verses.text: And they said: “It is not so, my lord. But your servants have arrived in order to buy food.

verses.name: Genesis 42:11
verses.text: We are all sons of one man. We have come in peace, nor do any of your subjects devise evil.”

verses.name: Genesis 42:12
verses.text: And he answered them: “It is otherwise. You have come to examine the unguarded parts of this land.”

verses.name: Genesis 42:13
verses.text: But they said: “We, your servants, are twelve brothers, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan. The youngest is with our father; the other is not living.”

verses.name: Genesis 42:14
verses.text: He said: “This is just as I have said. You are scouts.

verses.name: Genesis 42:15
verses.text: I will now continue to put you to the test. By the health of Pharaoh, you will not depart from here, until your youngest brother arrives.

verses.name: Genesis 42:16
verses.text: Send one of you and bring him. But you will be in chains, until what you have said is proven to be either true or false. Otherwise, by the health of Pharaoh, you are scouts.”

verses.name: Genesis 42:17
verses.text: Therefore, he delivered them into custody for three days.

verses.name: Genesis 42:18
verses.text: Then, on the third day, he brought them out of prison, and he said: “Do as I have said, and you will live. For I fear God.

verses.name: Genesis 42:19
verses.text: If you are peaceful, let one of your brothers be bound in prison. Then you may go away and carry the grain that you have bought to your houses.

verses.name: Genesis 42:20
verses.text: And bring your youngest brother to me, so that I may be able to test your words, and you may not die.” They did as he had said,

verses.name: Genesis 42:21
verses.text: and they spoke to one another: “We deserve to suffer these things, because we have sinned against our brother, seeing the anguish of his soul, when he begged us and we would not listen. For that reason, this tribulation has come upon us.”

verses.name: Genesis 42:22
verses.text: And Reuben, one of them, said: “Did not I say to you, ‘Do not sin against the boy,’ and you would not listen to me? See, his blood is exacted.”

verses.name: Genesis 42:23
verses.text: But they did not know that Joseph understood, because he was speaking to them through an interpreter.

verses.name: Genesis 42:24
verses.text: And he turned himself away briefly and wept. And returning, he spoke to them.

verses.name: Genesis 42:25
verses.text: And taking Simeon, and binding him in their presence, he ordered his ministers to fill their sacks with wheat, and to replace each one’s money in their sacks, and to give them, in addition, provisions for the way. And they did so.

verses.name: Genesis 42:26
verses.text: Then, having loaded their donkeys with the grain, they set out.

verses.name: Genesis 42:27
verses.text: And one of them, opening a sack to give his beast of burden fodder at the inn, looked upon the money at the sack’s mouth,

verses.name: Genesis 42:28
verses.text: and he said to his brothers: “My money has returned to me. See, it is held in the sack.” And they were astonished and troubled, and they said to one another, “What is this that God has done to us?”

verses.name: Genesis 42:29
verses.text: And they went to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan, and they explained to him all the things that had befallen them, saying:

verses.name: Genesis 42:30
verses.text: “The lord of the land spoke harshly to us, and he considered us to be scouts of the province.

verses.name: Genesis 42:31
verses.text: And we answered him: ‘We are peaceful, and we do not intend any treachery.

verses.name: Genesis 42:32
verses.text: We are twelve brothers conceived of one father. One is not living; the youngest is with our father in the land of Canaan.’

verses.name: Genesis 42:33
verses.text: And he said to us: ‘Thus will I prove that you are peaceful. Release one of your brothers to me, and take necessary provisions for your houses, and go away,

verses.name: Genesis 42:34
verses.text: and bring your youngest brother to me, so that I may know that you are not scouts. And this one, who is held in chains, you may be able to receive again. And thereafter, you shall have permission to buy what you want.’ ”

verses.name: Genesis 42:35
verses.text: Having said this, when they poured out their grain, each found his money tied to the mouth of his sack. And all were terrified together.

verses.name: Genesis 42:36
verses.text: Their father Jacob said, “You have caused me to be without children. Joseph is not living, Simeon is held in chains, and Benjamin you would carry away. All these evils have fallen back upon me.”

verses.name: Genesis 42:37
verses.text: And Reuben answered him, “Put my two sons to death, if I do not lead him back to you. Deliver him into my hand, and I will restore him to you.”

verses.name: Genesis 42:38
verses.text: But he said: “My son will not go down with you. His brother is dead, and he is left alone. If any adversity will befall him in the land to which you travel, you would lead my grey hairs down with sorrow to the grave.”

verses.name: Genesis 43:1
verses.text: Meanwhile, the famine pressed heavily on all the land.

verses.name: Genesis 43:2
verses.text: And having consumed the provisions that they had brought out of Egypt, Jacob said to his sons, “Return and buy us a little food.”

verses.name: Genesis 43:3
verses.text: Judah answered: “The man himself declared to us, under the attestation of an oath, saying: ‘You will not see my face, unless you bring your youngest brother with you.’

verses.name: Genesis 43:4
verses.text: If therefore you are willing to send him with us, we will travel together, and we will buy necessities for you.

verses.name: Genesis 43:5
verses.text: But if you are not willing, we will not go. For the man, as we have often said, declared to us, saying: ‘You will not see my face without your youngest brother.’ ”

verses.name: Genesis 43:6
verses.text: Israel said to them, “You have done this for my misery, in that you revealed to him that you also had another brother.”

verses.name: Genesis 43:7
verses.text: But they responded: “The man questioned us in order, concerning our family: whether our father lived, if we had a brother. And we answered him respectively, according to what he demanded. How could we know that he would say, ‘Bring your brother with you?’ ”

verses.name: Genesis 43:8
verses.text: Likewise, Judah said to his father: “Send the boy with me, so that we may set out and be able to live, lest we and our little ones should die.

verses.name: Genesis 43:9
verses.text: I accept the boy; require him at my hand. Unless I lead him back and restore him to you, I will be guilty of a sin against you for all time.

verses.name: Genesis 43:10
verses.text: If a delay had not intervened, by now we would have returned here a second time.”

verses.name: Genesis 43:11
verses.text: Therefore, their father Israel said to them: “If it is necessary to do so, then do what you will. Take, in your vessels, from the best fruits of the land, and carry down gifts to the man: a little resin, and honey, and storax ointment, oil of myrrh, turpentine, and almonds.

verses.name: Genesis 43:12
verses.text: Also, take with you double the money, and carry back what you found in your sacks, lest perhaps it was done in error.

verses.name: Genesis 43:13
verses.text: But also take your brother, and go to the man.

verses.name: Genesis 43:14
verses.text: Then may my Almighty God cause him to be pleased by you. And send your brother, whom he holds, back with you, along with this one, Benjamin. But as for me, without my children, I will be like one who is bereaved.”

verses.name: Genesis 43:15
verses.text: Therefore, the men took the gifts, and double the money, and Benjamin. And they went down into Egypt, and they stood in the presence of Joseph.

verses.name: Genesis 43:16
verses.text: And when he had seen them and Benjamin together, he instructed the steward of his house, saying: “Lead the men into the house, and kill victims, and prepare a feast, because they will be eating with me at midday.”

verses.name: Genesis 43:17
verses.text: He did what he had been ordered to do, and he brought the men into the house.

verses.name: Genesis 43:18
verses.text: And there, being terrified, they said one to another: “Because of the money, which we carried back the first time in our sacks, we have been brought in, so that he may unleash a false accusation against us, and by violence subjugate both us and our donkeys into servitude.”

verses.name: Genesis 43:19
verses.text: For this reason, approaching the steward of the house at his door,

verses.name: Genesis 43:20
verses.text: they said: “We beg you, lord, to hear us. We came down once before to buy food.

verses.name: Genesis 43:21
verses.text: And having bought it, when we arrived at the inn, we opened our sacks and found the money in the mouths of the sacks, which we now have carried back in the same amount.

verses.name: Genesis 43:22
verses.text: But we have also brought other silver, so that we may buy those things that are necessary for us. It is not on our conscience who had placed it in our bags.”

verses.name: Genesis 43:23
verses.text: But he responded: “Peace be with you. Do not be afraid. Your God, and the God of your father, has given you the treasure in your sacks. As for the money that you gave to me, I held it as a test.” And he led Simeon out to them.

verses.name: Genesis 43:24
verses.text: And having led them into the house, he brought water, and they washed their feet, and he gave fodder to their donkeys.

verses.name: Genesis 43:25
verses.text: But they also prepared the gifts, until Joseph entered at midday. For they had heard that they would eat bread there.

verses.name: Genesis 43:26
verses.text: And so Joseph entered his house, and they offered him the gifts, holding them in their hands. And they reverenced prone on the ground.

verses.name: Genesis 43:27
verses.text: But he, gently greeting them again, questioned them, saying: “Is your father, the old man about whom you spoke to me, in good health? Is he still alive?”

verses.name: Genesis 43:28
verses.text: And they answered: “Your servant, our father, is safe; he is still alive.” And bowing, they reverenced him.

verses.name: Genesis 43:29
verses.text: Then Joseph, lifting up his eyes, saw Benjamin, his brother of the same womb, and he said, “Is this your little brother, about whom you spoke to me?” And again, he said, “May God be compassionate to you, my son.”

verses.name: Genesis 43:30
verses.text: And he hurried out, because his heart had been moved over his brother, and tears gushed out. And going into his chamber, he wept.

verses.name: Genesis 43:31
verses.text: And when he had washed his face, coming out again, he composed himself, and he said, “Set out bread.”

verses.name: Genesis 43:32
verses.text: And when it was set out, separately for Joseph, and separately for his brothers, likewise separately for the Egyptians, who ate at the same time, (for it is unlawful for Egyptians to eat with Hebrews, and they consider feasting in this way to be profane)

verses.name: Genesis 43:33
verses.text: they sat before him, the firstborn according to his birthright, and the youngest according to his state of life. And they wondered exceedingly,

verses.name: Genesis 43:34
verses.text: taking the portions that they received from him. And the greater portion went to Benjamin, so much so that it exceeded five parts. And they drank and became inebriated along with him.

verses.name: Genesis 44:1
verses.text: Then Joseph instructed the steward of his house, saying: “Fill their sacks with grain, as much as they are able to hold. And place each one’s money at the top of the sack.

verses.name: Genesis 44:2
verses.text: But place my silver bowl, and the price that he gave for the wheat, in the mouth of the sack of the youngest.” And so it was done.

verses.name: Genesis 44:3
verses.text: And when morning arose, they were sent away with their donkeys.

verses.name: Genesis 44:4
verses.text: And now they had departed from the city and had set out a short distance. Then Joseph, sending for the steward of his house, said: “Rise up and pursue the men. And when you have overtaken them, say: ‘Why have you returned evil for good?

verses.name: Genesis 44:5
verses.text: The cup that you have stolen, it is that from which my lord drinks, and in which he is accustomed to discern signs. You have done a very sinful thing.’ ”

verses.name: Genesis 44:6
verses.text: He did as he had been ordered. And having overtaken them, he spoke to them according to the order.

verses.name: Genesis 44:7
verses.text: And they responded: “Why does our lord speak in this way, as though your servants had committed such a shameful act?

verses.name: Genesis 44:8
verses.text: The money, which we found at the top of our sacks, we carried back to you from the land of Canaan. So in what way does it follow that we would steal, from the house of your lord, gold or silver?

verses.name: Genesis 44:9
verses.text: Whichever of your servants will be found to have what you seek, may he die, and we shall be the servants of my lord.”

verses.name: Genesis 44:10
verses.text: And he said to them: “Let it be according to your verdict. With whomever it will be found, let him be my servant, but you will be unharmed.”

verses.name: Genesis 44:11
verses.text: And so, they quickly placed their sacks down to the ground, and each one was opened.

verses.name: Genesis 44:12
verses.text: And when he had searched, beginning with the oldest, all the way to the youngest, he found the cup in Benjamin’s sack.

verses.name: Genesis 44:13
verses.text: But they, tearing their garments and burdening their donkeys again, returned to the town.

verses.name: Genesis 44:14
verses.text: And Judah, first among his brothers, entered to Joseph (for he had not yet departed from the place) and together they all fell down before him to the ground.

verses.name: Genesis 44:15
verses.text: And he said to them: “Why would you choose to act in this way? Could you be ignorant that there is no one like me in the knowledge of discerning signs?”

verses.name: Genesis 44:16
verses.text: And Judah said to him, “What could we answer to my lord? And what would we be able to say, or to justly claim? God has discovered the iniquity of your servants. See, we have all become servants to my lord, both we, and he with whom the cup was found.”

verses.name: Genesis 44:17
verses.text: Joseph responded: “Far be it from me that I should act in this way. He who stole the cup, he will be my servant. But you may go away free to your father.”

verses.name: Genesis 44:18
verses.text: Then Judah, approaching closer, said confidently: “I beg you, my lord, let your servant speak a word in your ears, and do not be angry with your servant. For you are next to Pharaoh.

verses.name: Genesis 44:19
verses.text: My lord, you questioned your servants before: ‘Do you have a father or a brother?’

verses.name: Genesis 44:20
verses.text: And we answered you, my lord: ‘There is our father, an old man, and a young boy, who was born in his old age. His brother of the same womb has died, and he alone is left to his mother and father, who truly love him tenderly.’

verses.name: Genesis 44:21
verses.text: And you said to your servants, ‘Bring him to me, and I will set my eyes on him.’

verses.name: Genesis 44:22
verses.text: We suggested to my lord: ‘The boy is not able to leave his father. For if he sends him away, he will die.’

verses.name: Genesis 44:23
verses.text: And you said to your servants: ‘Unless your youngest brother arrives with you, you will not see my face any more.’

verses.name: Genesis 44:24
verses.text: Therefore, when we had gone up to your servant our father, we explained to him all that my lord had spoken.

verses.name: Genesis 44:25
verses.text: And our father said: ‘Return and buy us a little wheat.’

verses.name: Genesis 44:26
verses.text: And we said to him: ‘We cannot go. If our youngest brother descends with us, we will set out together. Otherwise, in his absence, we do not dare to see the face of the man.’

verses.name: Genesis 44:27
verses.text: To which he responded: ‘You know that my wife conceived twice by me.

verses.name: Genesis 44:28
verses.text: One went out, and you said, “A beast devoured him.” And since then, he has not appeared.

verses.name: Genesis 44:29
verses.text: If you take this one also, and anything happens to him on the way, you will lead my grey hairs down with grief to the grave.’

verses.name: Genesis 44:30
verses.text: Therefore, if I would have gone to your servant, our father, with the boy not present, (though his life depends upon the life of him)

verses.name: Genesis 44:31
verses.text: and if he were to see that he is not with us, he would die, and your servants will lead his grey hairs down with sorrow to the grave.

verses.name: Genesis 44:32
verses.text: Let me be your very own servant, for I accepted this one into my trust, and I promised, saying: ‘Unless I lead him back, I will be guilty of a sin against my father for all time.’

verses.name: Genesis 44:33
verses.text: And so I, your servant, will remain in place of the boy, in ministry to my lord, and then let the boy go up with his brothers.

verses.name: Genesis 44:34
verses.text: For I cannot return to my father without the boy, lest I appear as a witness to the calamity that will oppress my father.”

verses.name: Genesis 45:1
verses.text: Joseph was unable to restrain himself any longer, standing before so many. Therefore, he instructed that all should go outside, and that no stranger should be among them as they recognized one another.

verses.name: Genesis 45:2
verses.text: And he lifted up his voice with weeping, which the Egyptians heard, along with the entire house of Pharaoh.

verses.name: Genesis 45:3
verses.text: And he said to his brothers: “I am Joseph. Is my father still alive?” His brothers were unable to respond, being terrified by a very great fear.

verses.name: Genesis 45:4
verses.text: And he said to them mildly, “Approach toward me.” And when they had approached close by, he said: “I am Joseph, your brother, whom you sold into Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 45:5
verses.text: Do not be afraid, and let it not seem to you to be a hardship that you sold me into these regions. For God sent me before you into Egypt for your salvation.

verses.name: Genesis 45:6
verses.text: For it is two years since the famine began to be upon the land, and five years more remain, in which there can be neither plowing, nor reaping.

verses.name: Genesis 45:7
verses.text: And God sent me ahead, so that you may be preserved upon the earth, and so that you would be able to have food in order to live.

verses.name: Genesis 45:8
verses.text: I was sent here, not by your counsel, but by the will of God. He has caused me to be like a father to Pharaoh, and to be the lord of his entire house, as well as governor throughout all the land of Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 45:9
verses.text: Hurry, and go up to my father, and say to him: ‘Your son Joseph commands this: God has caused me to be lord of the entire land of Egypt. Come down to me, do not delay,

verses.name: Genesis 45:10
verses.text: and you will live in the land of Goshen. And you will be next to me, you and your sons and the sons of your sons, your sheep and your herds, and all that you possess.

verses.name: Genesis 45:11
verses.text: And there I will pasture you, (for there are still five years of famine remaining) lest both you and your house perish, along with all that you possess.’

verses.name: Genesis 45:12
verses.text: Behold, your eyes and the eyes of my brother Benjamin can see that it is my mouth speaking to you.

verses.name: Genesis 45:13
verses.text: You will report to my father about all my glory, and about all that you have seen in Egypt. Hurry, and bring him to me.”

verses.name: Genesis 45:14
verses.text: And then falling upon the neck of his brother Benjamin, he embraced him and wept. And likewise, Benjamin wept at the same time on his neck.

verses.name: Genesis 45:15
verses.text: And Joseph kissed all his brothers, and he cried over each one. After this, they were emboldened to speak to him.

verses.name: Genesis 45:16
verses.text: And it was overheard, and the news spread by word throughout the king’s court. The brothers of Joseph had arrived, and Pharaoh was gladdened along with all his family.

verses.name: Genesis 45:17
verses.text: And he told Joseph that he should command his brothers, saying: “ ‘Burden your beasts, and go into the land of Canaan,

verses.name: Genesis 45:18
verses.text: and take from there your father and kindred, and come to me. And I will give you all the good things of Egypt, so that you may eat from the marrow of the land.’ ”

verses.name: Genesis 45:19
verses.text: “And you may even instruct that they take wagons from the land of Egypt, in order to transport their little ones as well as their wives. And say: ‘Take your father, and come quickly, as soon as possible.

verses.name: Genesis 45:20
verses.text: You need not give up anything from your household, for all the riches of Egypt will be yours.’ ”

verses.name: Genesis 45:21
verses.text: And the sons of Israel did just as they were commanded. And Joseph gave them wagons, according to the command of Pharaoh, and provisions for the journey.

verses.name: Genesis 45:22
verses.text: Likewise, he ordered two robes for each of them to be brought. Yet truly, to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver along with five of the best robes.

verses.name: Genesis 45:23
verses.text: And he sent just as much money and clothing to his father, adding also ten male donkeys, with which to transport all the riches of Egypt, and as many female donkeys, carrying wheat and bread for the journey.

verses.name: Genesis 45:24
verses.text: Thus he sent away his brothers, and as they set out he said, “Do not become angry on the way.”

verses.name: Genesis 45:25
verses.text: And they ascended out of Egypt, and they arrived in the land of Canaan, to their father Jacob.

verses.name: Genesis 45:26
verses.text: And they reported to him, saying: “Your son Joseph is alive, and he is ruler throughout all the land of Egypt. When Jacob heard this, he was stirred up, as if from a deep sleep, yet he did not believe them.

verses.name: Genesis 45:27
verses.text: To the contrary, they explained the entire matter in order. And when he had seen the wagons, and all that he had sent, his spirit revived,

verses.name: Genesis 45:28
verses.text: and he said: “It is enough for me, if my son Joseph is still alive. I will go and see him before I die.”

verses.name: Genesis 46:1
verses.text: And Israel, setting out with all that he had, arrived at the Well of the Oath. And sacrificing victims there to the God of his father Isaac,

verses.name: Genesis 46:2
verses.text: he heard him, by a vision in the night, calling him, and saying to him: “Jacob, Jacob.” And he answered him, “Behold, here I am.”

verses.name: Genesis 46:3
verses.text: God said to him: “I am the most strong God of your father. Do not be afraid. Descend into Egypt, for there I will make of you a great nation.

verses.name: Genesis 46:4
verses.text: I will descend with you to that place, and I will lead you back from there, returning. Also, Joseph will place his hands over your eyes.

verses.name: Genesis 46:5
verses.text: Then Jacob rose up from the Well of the Oath. And his sons took him, with their little ones and wives, in the wagons that Pharaoh had sent to carry the old man,

verses.name: Genesis 46:6
verses.text: along with all that he possessed in the land of Canaan. And he arrived in Egypt with all his offspring:

verses.name: Genesis 46:7
verses.text: his sons and his grandsons, his daughters and all his progeny together.

verses.name: Genesis 46:8
verses.text: Now these are the names of the sons of Israel, who entered into Egypt, he with his children. The firstborn is Reuben.

verses.name: Genesis 46:9
verses.text: The sons of Reuben: Hanoch and Pallu, and Hezron and Carmi.

verses.name: Genesis 46:10
verses.text: The sons of Simeon: Jemuel and Jamin and Ohad, and Jachin and Zohar, and Shaul, the son of a Canaanite woman.

verses.name: Genesis 46:11
verses.text: The sons of Levi: Gershon and Kohath, and Merari.

verses.name: Genesis 46:12
verses.text: The sons of Judah: Er and Onan, and Shelah, and Perez and Zerah. Now Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan. And sons were born to Perez: Hezron and Hamul.

verses.name: Genesis 46:13
verses.text: The sons of Issachar: Tola and Puvah, and Job and Shimron.

verses.name: Genesis 46:14
verses.text: The sons of Zebulun: Sered and Elon and Jahleel.

verses.name: Genesis 46:15
verses.text: These are the sons of Leah, whom she bore, along with his daughter Dinah, in Mesopotamia of Syria. All the souls of her sons and daughters are thirty-three.

verses.name: Genesis 46:16
verses.text: The sons of Gad: Ziphion and Haggi, and Shuni and Ezbon, and Eri and Arodi, and Areli.

verses.name: Genesis 46:17
verses.text: The sons of Asher: Imnah and Jesua, and Jessui and Beriah, and also their sister Sarah. The sons of Beria: Heber and Malchiel.

verses.name: Genesis 46:18
verses.text: These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to his daughter Leah. And these she bore to Jacob: sixteen souls.

verses.name: Genesis 46:19
verses.text: The sons of Rachel, the wife of Jacob: Joseph and Benjamin.

verses.name: Genesis 46:20
verses.text: And sons were born to Joseph in the land of Egypt, whom Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera, priest of Heliopolis, bore for him: Manasseh and Ephraim.

verses.name: Genesis 46:21
verses.text: The sons of Benjamin: Bela and Becher, and Ashbel and Gera, and Naaman and Ehi, and Rosh and Moppim, and Huppim and Ard.

verses.name: Genesis 46:22
verses.text: These are the sons of Rachel, whom she bore to Jacob: all these souls are fourteen.

verses.name: Genesis 46:23
verses.text: The sons of Dan: Hushim.

verses.name: Genesis 46:24
verses.text: The sons of Naphtali: Jahzeel and Guni, and Jezer and Shillem.

verses.name: Genesis 46:25
verses.text: These are the sons of Bilhah, whom Laban gave to his daughter Rachel, and these she bore to Jacob: all these souls are seven.

verses.name: Genesis 46:26
