verses.text: All the souls who went into Egypt with Jacob and who went out from his thigh, besides the wives of his sons, were sixty-six.

verses.name: Genesis 46:27
verses.text: Now the sons of Joseph, who were born to him in the land of Egypt, were two souls. All the souls of the house of Jacob, who went into Egypt, were seventy.

verses.name: Genesis 46:28
verses.text: Then he sent Judah ahead of himself, to Joseph, in order to report to him, and so that he would meet him in Goshen.

verses.name: Genesis 46:29
verses.text: And when he had arrived there, Joseph harnessed his chariot, and he went up to meet his father at the same place. And seeing him, he fell upon his neck, and, amid embraces, he wept.

verses.name: Genesis 46:30
verses.text: And the father said to Joseph, “Now I will die happy, because I have seen your face, and I am leaving you behind alive.”

verses.name: Genesis 46:31
verses.text: And he said to his brothers and to all his father’s house: “I will go up and report to Pharaoh, and I will say to him: ‘My brothers, and my father’s house, who were in the land of Canaan, have come to me.

verses.name: Genesis 46:32
verses.text: And these honorable men are pastors of sheep, and they have the task of feeding the flock. Their cattle, and herds, and all that they were able to hold, they have brought with them.’

verses.name: Genesis 46:33
verses.text: And when he will call you and will say, ‘What is your work?’

verses.name: Genesis 46:34
verses.text: You will respond, ‘Your servants are pastors of honor, from our infancy even to the present time, both we and our fathers.’ Now you will say this so that you may be able to live in the land of Goshen, because the Egyptians detest all pastors of sheep.”

verses.name: Genesis 47:1
verses.text: And so Joseph entered and reported to Pharaoh, saying: “My father and brothers, their sheep and herds, and everything that they possess, have arrived from the land of Canaan. And behold, they stand together in the land of Goshen.”

verses.name: Genesis 47:2
verses.text: Likewise, he stood in the sight of the king five men, the last of his brothers.

verses.name: Genesis 47:3
verses.text: And he questioned them, “What do you have for work?” They responded: “Your servants are pastors of sheep, both we and our fathers.

verses.name: Genesis 47:4
verses.text: We came to sojourn in your land, because there is no grass for the flocks of your servants, the famine being very grievous in the land of Canaan. And we petition you that you may order us, your servants, to be in the land of Goshen.”

verses.name: Genesis 47:5
verses.text: And so the king said to Joseph: “Your father and brothers have come to you.

verses.name: Genesis 47:6
verses.text: The land of Egypt is in your sight. Cause them to live in the best place, and deliver to them the land of Goshen. And if you know there to be industrious men among them, appoint these as foremen over my cattle.”

verses.name: Genesis 47:7
verses.text: After this, Joseph brought in his father to the king, and he stood him in his sight. He blessed him,

verses.name: Genesis 47:8
verses.text: and he questioned him: “How many are the days of the years of your life?”

verses.name: Genesis 47:9
verses.text: He responded, “The days of my sojourn are one hundred and thirty years, few and unworthy, and they do not reach even to the days of the sojourning of my fathers.”

verses.name: Genesis 47:10
verses.text: And blessing the king, he went outside.

verses.name: Genesis 47:11
verses.text: Truly, Joseph gave his father and brothers a possession in Egypt, in the best place of the land, in Rameses, as Pharaoh had instructed.

verses.name: Genesis 47:12
verses.text: And he fed them, along with all his father’s house, providing portions of food to each one.

verses.name: Genesis 47:13
verses.text: For in the whole world there was a lack of bread, and a famine had oppressed the land, most of all Egypt and Canaan,

verses.name: Genesis 47:14
verses.text: from which he gathered together all the money for the grain that they bought, and he took it into the treasury of the king.

verses.name: Genesis 47:15
verses.text: And when the buyers had run out of money, all Egypt came to Joseph, saying: “Give us bread. Why should we die in your sight, lacking money?”

verses.name: Genesis 47:16
verses.text: And he responded to them: “Bring me your cattle, and I will give food to you in exchange for them, if you do not have money.”

verses.name: Genesis 47:17
verses.text: And when they had brought them, he gave them food for their horses, and sheep, and oxen, and donkeys. And he sustained them in that year in exchange for their cattle.

verses.name: Genesis 47:18
verses.text: Likewise, they came the second year, and they said to him: “We will not conceal from our lord that our money is gone; likewise our cattle are gone. Neither are you unaware that we have nothing left but our bodies and our land.

verses.name: Genesis 47:19
verses.text: Therefore, why should you watch us die? Both we and our land will be yours. Buy us into royal servitude, but provide seed, lest by the dying off of cultivators the land be reduced to a wilderness.”

verses.name: Genesis 47:20
verses.text: Therefore, Joseph bought all the land of Egypt, each one selling his possessions because of the magnitude of the famine. And he subjected it to Pharaoh,

verses.name: Genesis 47:21
verses.text: along with all of its people, from the newest borders of Egypt, even to its furthest limits,

verses.name: Genesis 47:22
verses.text: except the land of the priests, which had been delivered to them by the king. To these also a portion of food was supplied out of the public storehouses, and, for this reason, they were not compelled to sell their possessions.

verses.name: Genesis 47:23
verses.text: Therefore, Joseph said to the people: “So, as you discern, both you and your lands are possessed by Pharaoh; take seed and sow the fields,

verses.name: Genesis 47:24
verses.text: so that you may be able to have grain. One fifth part you will give to the king; the remaining four I permit to you, as seed and as food for your families and children.

verses.name: Genesis 47:25
verses.text: And they responded: “Our health is in your hand; only let our lord look kindly upon us, and we will serve the king with gladness.”

verses.name: Genesis 47:26
verses.text: From that time, even to the present day, in the entire land of Egypt, the fifth part is turned over to the kings, and it has become like a law, except in the land of the priests, which was free from this condition.

verses.name: Genesis 47:27
verses.text: And so, Israel lived in Egypt, that is, in the land of Goshen, and he possessed it. And he increased and was multiplied exceedingly.

verses.name: Genesis 47:28
verses.text: And he lived in it seventeen years. And all the days of his life that passed were one hundred and forty-seven years.

verses.name: Genesis 47:29
verses.text: And when he discerned that the day of his death was approaching, he called his son Joseph, and he said to him: “If I have found favor in your sight, place your hand under my thigh. And you shall show me mercy and truth, not to bury me in Egypt.

verses.name: Genesis 47:30
verses.text: But I shall sleep with my fathers, and you will carry me from this land and bury me in the sepulcher of my ancestors.” And Joseph answered him, “I will do what you have ordered.”

verses.name: Genesis 47:31
verses.text: And he said, “Then swear it to me.” And as he was swearing, Israel adored God, turning to the head of his resting place.

verses.name: Genesis 48:1
verses.text: After these things were done, it was reported to Joseph that his father was sick. And taking his two sons Manasseh and Ephraim, he went directly to him.

verses.name: Genesis 48:2
verses.text: And it was told to the old man, “Behold, your son Joseph is coming to you.” And being strengthened, he sat up in bed.

verses.name: Genesis 48:3
verses.text: And when he had entered to him, he said: “Almighty God appeared to me at Luz, which is in the land of Canaan, and he blessed me.

verses.name: Genesis 48:4
verses.text: And he said: ‘I will increase and multiply you, and I will make you influential among the people. And I will give this land to you, and to your offspring after you, as an everlasting possession.’

verses.name: Genesis 48:5
verses.text: Therefore, your two sons, who were born to you in the land of Egypt before I came here to you, will be mine. Ephraim and Manasseh will be treated by me just like Reuben and Simeon.

verses.name: Genesis 48:6
verses.text: But the remainder, whom you will conceive after them, will be yours, and they will be called by the name of their brothers among their possessions.

verses.name: Genesis 48:7
verses.text: As for me, when I came from Mesopotamia, Rachel died in the land of Canaan on the very journey, and it was springtime. And I entered Ephrath and buried her next to the way of Ephrath, which by another name is called Bethlehem.”

verses.name: Genesis 48:8
verses.text: Then, seeing his sons, he said to him: “Who are these?”

verses.name: Genesis 48:9
verses.text: He responded, “They are my sons, whom God gave to me as a gift in this place.” “Bring them to me,” he said, “so that I may bless them.”

verses.name: Genesis 48:10
verses.text: For Israel’s eyes were clouded by reason of his great age, and he was unable to see clearly. And when they were placed up against him, he kissed and embraced them.

verses.name: Genesis 48:11
verses.text: And he said to his son: “I have not been cheated out of seeing you. Moreover, God has shown me your offspring.”

verses.name: Genesis 48:12
verses.text: And when Joseph had taken them from his father’s lap, he reverenced prone on the ground.

verses.name: Genesis 48:13
verses.text: And he placed Ephraim on his right, that is, towards the left hand of Israel. Yet truly Manasseh was on his left, namely, towards his father’s right hand. And he placed them both up against him.

verses.name: Genesis 48:14
verses.text: And he, extending his right hand, placed it over the head of Ephraim, the younger brother, but the left hand was on the head of Manasseh, who was the elder, so that his hands were crossed.

verses.name: Genesis 48:15
verses.text: And Jacob blessed the sons of Joseph, and he said: “God, in whose sight my fathers, Abraham and Isaac, walked; God, who pastured me from my youth until the present day;

verses.name: Genesis 48:16
verses.text: the Angel, who rescues me from all evils: bless these boys. And let my name be invoked over them, and also the names of my fathers, Abraham and Isaac. And may they increase into a multitude across the earth.”

verses.name: Genesis 48:17
verses.text: But Joseph, seeing that his father had placed his right hand over the head of Ephraim, took it gravely. And grasping his father’s hand, he tried to lift it from Ephraim’s head and transfer it onto the head of Manasseh.

verses.name: Genesis 48:18
verses.text: And he said to his father: “It should not have come to pass this way, father. For this one is the firstborn. Place your right hand over his head.”

verses.name: Genesis 48:19
verses.text: But refusing, he said: “I know, my son, I know. And this one, indeed, will be among the people and will be multiplied. But his younger brother will be greater than he. And his offspring will increase among the nations.”

verses.name: Genesis 48:20
verses.text: And he blessed them at that time, saying: “In you, Israel will be blessed, and it will be said: ‘May God treat you like Ephraim, and like Manasseh.’ ” And he established Ephraim before Manasseh.

verses.name: Genesis 48:21
verses.text: And he said to his son Joseph: “See, I am dying, and God will be with you, and he will lead you back to the land of your fathers.

verses.name: Genesis 48:22
verses.text: I give you one part beyond that of your brothers, which I took from the hand of the Amorite with my sword and my bow.”

verses.name: Genesis 49:1
verses.text: Then Jacob called his sons, and he said to them: “Gather together, so that I may announce what will happen to you in the last days.

verses.name: Genesis 49:2
verses.text: Gather together and listen, O sons of Jacob. Listen to Israel, your father.

verses.name: Genesis 49:3
verses.text: Reuben, my firstborn, you are my strength and the beginning of my sorrow: first in gifts, greater in authority.

verses.name: Genesis 49:4
verses.text: You are being poured out like water, may you not increase. For you climbed onto your father’s bed, and you defiled his resting place.

verses.name: Genesis 49:5
verses.text: The brothers Simeon and Levi: vessels of iniquity waging war.

verses.name: Genesis 49:6
verses.text: Let not my soul go by their counsel, nor my glory be within their meeting. For in their fury they killed a man, and in their self-will they undermined a wall.

verses.name: Genesis 49:7
verses.text: Cursed be their fury, because it was obstinate, and their indignation, because it was harsh. I will divide them in Jacob, and I will scatter them in Israel.

verses.name: Genesis 49:8
verses.text: Judah, your brothers will praise you. Your hand will be at the necks of your enemies; the sons of your father will reverence you.

verses.name: Genesis 49:9
verses.text: Judah is a lion’s young. You have gone up to the prey, my son. While resting, you have lain like a lion. And just like a lioness, who would rouse him?

verses.name: Genesis 49:10
verses.text: The scepter from Judah and the leader from his thigh will not be taken away, until he who will be sent arrives, and he will be the expectation of Gentiles.

verses.name: Genesis 49:11
verses.text: Tying his young colt to the vineyard, and his donkey, O my son, to the vine, he will wash his robe in wine, and his cloak in the blood of the grape.

verses.name: Genesis 49:12
verses.text: His eyes are more beautiful than wine, and his teeth whiter than milk.

verses.name: Genesis 49:13
verses.text: Zebulun will live at the seashore and by the outpost of ships, reaching as far as Sidon.

verses.name: Genesis 49:14
verses.text: Issachar will be a strong donkey, reclining between the borders.

verses.name: Genesis 49:15
verses.text: He saw that rest would be good, and that the land was excellent. And so he bent his shoulder to carry, and he became a servant under tribute.

verses.name: Genesis 49:16
verses.text: Dan will judge his people just like any other tribe in Israel.

verses.name: Genesis 49:17
verses.text: Let Dan be a snake in the way, a viper in the path, biting the hooves of horses, so that his rider may fall backward.

verses.name: Genesis 49:18
verses.text: I will wait for your salvation, O Lord.

verses.name: Genesis 49:19
verses.text: Gad, being girded, will fight before him. And he himself will be girded backward.

verses.name: Genesis 49:20
verses.text: Asher: his bread will be fat, and he will provide delicacies to the kings.

verses.name: Genesis 49:21
verses.text: Naphtali is a stag sent forth, offering words of eloquent beauty.

verses.name: Genesis 49:22
verses.text: Joseph is a growing son, a growing son and stately to behold; the daughters run back and forth on the wall.

verses.name: Genesis 49:23
verses.text: But those who held darts, provoked him, and they contend with him, and they envied him.

verses.name: Genesis 49:24
verses.text: His bow sits in strength, and the bands of his arms and hands have been let loose by the hands of the mighty one of Jacob. From there he went forth as a pastor, the stone of Israel.

verses.name: Genesis 49:25
verses.text: The God of your father will be your helper, and the Almighty will bless you with the blessings of heaven above, with the blessings of the abyss that lies beneath, with the blessings of the breasts and of the womb.

verses.name: Genesis 49:26
verses.text: The blessings of your father are strengthened by the blessings of his fathers, until the desire of the hills of eternity shall arrive. May they be at the head of Joseph, and at the summit of the Nazarite, among his brothers.

verses.name: Genesis 49:27
verses.text: Benjamin is a ravenous wolf, in the morning he will eat the prey, and in the evening he will divide the spoil.”

verses.name: Genesis 49:28
verses.text: All these are the twelve tribes of Israel. These things their father spoke to them, and he blessed each one with their proper blessings.

verses.name: Genesis 49:29
verses.text: And he instructed them, saying: “I am being gathered to my people. Bury me with my fathers in the double cave, which is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,

verses.name: Genesis 49:30
verses.text: opposite Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought, along with its field, from Ephron the Hittite, as a possession for burial.

verses.name: Genesis 49:31
verses.text: There they buried him, with his wife Sarah.” And there Isaac was buried with his wife Rebekah. There also Leah lies preserved.

verses.name: Genesis 49:32
verses.text: And having finished these commands by which he instructed his sons, he drew his feet onto the bed, and he passed away. And he was gathered to his people.

verses.name: Genesis 50:1
verses.text: Joseph, realizing this, fell upon his father’s face, weeping and kissing him.

verses.name: Genesis 50:2
verses.text: And he instructed his servant physicians to embalm his father with aromatics.

verses.name: Genesis 50:3
verses.text: And while they were fulfilling his orders, forty days passed. For this was the method of embalming dead bodies. And Egypt wept for him for seventy days.

verses.name: Genesis 50:4
verses.text: And when the time for mourning was fulfilled, Joseph spoke to the family of Pharaoh: “If I have found favor in your sight, speak to the ears of Pharaoh.

verses.name: Genesis 50:5
verses.text: For my father made me swear, saying: ‘See, I am dying. You shall bury me in my sepulcher which I dug for myself in the land of Canaan.’ Therefore, I shall go up and bury my father, and then return.”

verses.name: Genesis 50:6
verses.text: And Pharaoh said to him, “Go up and bury your father, just as he made you swear.”

verses.name: Genesis 50:7
verses.text: So as he went up, all the elders of the house of Pharaoh went with him, along with every patriarch in the land of Egypt,

verses.name: Genesis 50:8
verses.text: and the house of Joseph with his brothers, except their little ones and flocks and also the herds, which they left behind in the land of Goshen.

verses.name: Genesis 50:9
verses.text: Likewise, he had in his company chariots and horsemen. And it became a crowd without restraint.

verses.name: Genesis 50:10
verses.text: And they arrived at the threshing place of Atad, which is situated beyond the Jordan. There they spent seven full days celebrating the funeral rites with a great and vehement lamentation.

verses.name: Genesis 50:11
verses.text: And when the inhabitants of the land of Canaan had seen this, they said, “This is a great Lamentation for the Egyptians.” And for this reason, the name of that place was called, “The Lamentation of Egypt.”

verses.name: Genesis 50:12
verses.text: And so, the sons of Jacob did just as he had instructed them.

verses.name: Genesis 50:13
verses.text: And carrying him into the land of Canaan, they buried him in the double cave, which Abraham had bought along with its field, from Ephron the Hittite, as a possession for burial, opposite Mamre.

verses.name: Genesis 50:14
verses.text: And Joseph returned into Egypt with his brothers and all those of his company, having buried his father.

verses.name: Genesis 50:15
verses.text: Now that he was dead, his brothers were afraid, and they said to one another: “Perhaps now he may remember the injury that he suffered and requite us for all the evil that we did to him.”

verses.name: Genesis 50:16
verses.text: So they sent a message to him, saying: “Your father instructed us before he died,

verses.name: Genesis 50:17
verses.text: that we should say these words to you from him: ‘I beg you to forget the wickedness of your brothers, and the sin and malice that they practiced against you.’ Likewise, we petition you to release the servants of the God of your father from this iniquity.” Hearing this, Joseph wept.

verses.name: Genesis 50:18
verses.text: And his brothers went to him. And reverencing prostrate on the ground, they said, “We are your servants.”

verses.name: Genesis 50:19
verses.text: And he answered them: “Do not be afraid. Are we able to resist the will of God?

verses.name: Genesis 50:20
verses.text: You devised evil against me. But God turned it into good, so that he might exalt me, just as you presently discern, and so that he might bring about the salvation of many peoples.

verses.name: Genesis 50:21
verses.text: Do not be afraid. I will pasture you and your little ones.” And he consoled them, and he spoke mildly and leniently.

verses.name: Genesis 50:22
verses.text: And he lived in Egypt with all his father’s house; and he survived for one hundred and ten years. And he saw the sons of Ephraim to the third generation. Likewise, the sons of Machir, the son of Manasseh, were born onto Joseph’s knees.

verses.name: Genesis 50:23
verses.text: After these things happened, he said to his brothers: “God will visit you after my death, and he will make you ascend from this land into the land which he swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.”

verses.name: Genesis 50:24
verses.text: And when he had made them swear and had said, “God will visit you; carry my bones with you from this place,”

verses.name: Genesis 50:25
verses.text: he died, having completed one hundred and ten years of his life. And having been embalmed with aromatics, he was laid to rest in a coffin in Egypt.
